report.summary: key exchange problem
report.label: bug
report.description: key exchanges take place many times when both sides start secure session at the same time, I have to exit this app to stop key exchanges

report.summary: Group sms do not send encrypted messages.
report.label: bug
report.description: When sending a sms to several people, the sms is not encrypted when it is sent to people you have initiated a secure session with. I have only tried this with sending sms to two people, one with a secure session and one without, and the sms is sent unencrypted to both.

report.summary: Decryption errors after restore
report.label: bug
report.description: TextSecure working fine -> Export to SD -> firmware upgrade -> fresh installation (same TS version) -> Import (successfull) and then: "Decryption error: local message corrupted, MAC doesn't match. Potential tampering?" Fallback to original firmware didn't help. Is it possible that something was lost/corrupted during export? Databases (messages.db and canonical_address.db) can be read with sqlite. Can messages be deciphered directly on a Linux machine?

report.summary: Opens to most recent conversation, can't get back to conversation list.
report.label: bug
report.description: This has been happening randomly for me lately, I assume it's since the latest update. My passphrase is cached, and when I go to open TextSecure, it opens to the most recent conversation. Hitting the back key seems to just close and re-open the same conversation. The only way I seem to be able to open the conversation list is by killing the two TextSecure processes from the running apps list. Then when I restart, if I enter into a different conversation from the list, exiting that conversation by pressing the back key, brings me back to the most recent conversation again, not the conversation list. I think it might be worth noting also that deleting the conversation thread that persistently shows (most recent...usually...I think), doesn't solve the issue, a blank/new thread with the same contact is shown in place of the deleted one. If it helps, I've got a Sony Xperia S LT26i running Android 4.0.4 If there's any other information I can provide, just let me know here. Thanks! :)

report.summary: "secure session" state gets out of sync
report.label: bug
report.description: Using version 0.7.4 from Google Play. TextSecure instances of two communicating users seem to disagree on whether a secure session is established. How to reproduce: User A and User B do NOT have TextSecure installed. User A installs TextSecure. The "automatically complete key exchanges" option is ON. User A attempts to initiate a secure session with User B. User B installs TextSecure. The "automatically complete key exchanges" option is ON. User B attempts to initiate a secure session with User A. At this point, User A's device believes that the secure session IS established, but User B's device believes that the secure session IS NOT established. An encrypted message sent from A to B will show up on B's device as Message encrypted for non-existing session.... User A aborts the secure session with User B. User A attempts to initiate a secure session with User B again. At this point, User B's device believes that the secure session IS established, but User A's device believes that the secure session IS NOT established. An encrypted message sent from B to A will show up on A's device as Message encrypted for non-existing session.... User B aborts the secure session with User A. User B attempts to initiate a secure session with User A again. At this point the cycle repeats.

report.summary: Message notification status "out of sync"
report.label: bug
report.description: Had an MMS (unencrypted) from someone, and every time I now receive a message (SMS or MMS) I get a "new message" notification (e.g. showing "(2) new messages" even though there is only one new one) -- this happens even though the message has been read and deleted. I've a hard time reproducing it. It's persistent through reboots, though.

report.summary: Timeout interval setting for passphrase doesn't show timeout
report.label: bug
report.description: Dropdown allows choice of "hours" or "minutes" and there is a slider below, but there is no way to determine what the timeout is.

report.summary: Incomplete migration
report.label: bug
report.description: Migration of system text messages didn't migrate many messages. It took three of the most recent message contacts and copied the contacts name for the most recent message, but no messages were actually copied. This person has over 3000 messages stored on my phone. The next two contacts that were copied over had a single message each, but when migrated they show up as triplicates. No other messages are copied

report.summary: TextSecure on JellyBam v3.0.0 (Android 4.1.2 + Android 4.2.0) loops exchange message
report.label: bug
report.description: A friend of mine installed TextSecure on his Galaxy SII. He initiated the key exchange I received his key and TextSecure automatically sent my key to him He received 2 Key exchange message from me It reinitiated the session, sent me back a key I sent back a key on and on and on.

report.summary: Wrong contact name in thread list view after uninstall/reinstall/import from sd
report.label: bug
report.description: To repro: Send text to one contact from TextSecure, and to a different contact from system sms app, so that you have different names at the top of each app's thread lists. Export to SD. Uninstall. Reinstall. Import messages from system sms app. Import from SD. The first thread in TextSecure thread list now has the contact name from the first thread in the system sms app, though the thread itself is correct and shows the correct contact in its own view.

report.summary: Message splitting
report.label: bug
report.description: My messages fail if they are longer than 160 characters instead of being split into multiple messages.

report.summary: Text messages going to default messaging app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have been receiving text messages occasionally in the default app, rather than then being (as they have been until now) all processed by TextSecure. Assuming the recent update might have something to do with this. Using a Nexus 4 with Android 4.2.2

report.summary: invalid password forever
report.label: bug
report.description: Basically I cant login the app anymore even though I'm positive I'm using the correct password. It keeps saying that the password is invalid over and over. I'm using same password to unlock my phone, could this be the issue? Again not sure how to reproduce this. Thanks Edit: forgot to mention that I'm using SGS3

report.summary: Multi receipient not working
report.label: bug
report.description: Sending to multiple recipients (some using TextSecure, some not) is not working. When viewing details of the failed message, TextSecure shows it as a MMS. When I use the regular Andriod Messaging app, I have similar problems until I configure Messaging to not use MMS for multiple recipients. There's no such config option in TextSecure.

report.summary: Picture from changed or new contacts not synchronized
report.label: bug
report.description: It ocured to me that TextSecure does not synchronize the contact photo of newly created or edited contacts after the initial import of all messages. There should be a check on application start.

report.summary: App dumped passphrase
report.label: bug
report.description: My phone is a HTC Droid DNA The app will no longer accept my passphrase. I did not change it. I had Passphrase captured indicated on the phone, yet it still asked for my passphrase.

report.summary: Attachment/APN problems
report.label: bug
report.description: When I select add an attachment after opening a thread, textsecure prompts me to enter my APN settings. I've already filled the fields.Selecting okay tells me I can change the settings at any time then brings me back to my message. Selecting cancel just brings me back to the message. Selecting add attachment looks the cycle. This happens with both secure and insecure sessions. My Carrier Is Bell Mobility (Canada) and I've posted a logcat to http://pastebin.com/PjV0Bhu3

report.summary: Group chat uses mms?
report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed that when sending a group message, textsecure opens up my 3g connection (instead of wifi) and tries to send it as an MMS. Why? It usually fails because MMS has always been flaky on my phone. Besides which, I'm trying to send text not mms (usually unencrypted to people who don't have textsecure). After digging though the issues on here I found out about the stealthy "go straight or right turn" broadcast/conversation switch, which sounds like it will do what I want, but i thought I'd still log it anyway.

report.summary: Cannot mark a message as read using the notification action if it is the first message from a new contact
report.label: bug
report.description: If a new message comes in from a brand-new phone number that doesn't already have an existing thread, you cannot mark that message as read. Subsequent messages from that contact can be cleared via the notification action, however. I am running stock Android 4.2.2 on a Nexus 4.

report.summary: Cant receive MMS with wifi turned on
report.label: bug
report.description: Get the message "Connecting to MMS server" for a while, then switches to the "Download" button. Download will only succeed with wifi turned off. On Verizon.

report.summary: Portrait Images Improperly Resized
report.label: bug
report.description: Pictures taken in a portrait orientation are re-sized improperly when attached to an MMS. Pictures added should keep their aspect ratio. I can upload pictures for an example if needed.

report.summary: MasterSecretUtil salt size of 8 bytes below NIST recommended minimum of 16 bytes
report.label: bug
report.description: The generateSalt() method in MasterSecretUtil uses 8 bytes (64 bits) while NIST recommends a minimum of 16 bytes (128 bits). https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/crypto/MasterSecretUtil.java#L235 NIST documentation "Recommendation for Password-Based Key Derivation Part 1: Storage Applications" - http://csrc.nist.gov/publications/nistpubs/800-132/nist-sp800-132.pdf NIST documentation excerpt from page 10, "5.1 The Salt (S) All or a portion of the salt shall be generated using an approved Random Bit Generator (e.g., see [5]). The length of the randomly-generated portion of the salt shall be at least 128 bits." Can this be adjusted to at least 128 bits by changing new byte[8] to new byte[16]?

report.summary: After importing backup: "Error decrypting message."
report.label: bug
report.description: I upgraded from Android 2.1 to CyanogenMod 10.1. I had a recent version of TextSecure (from June or July 2013) on the old system and exported an encrypted backup. I installed TextSecure on the new OS. After importing the backup every text is displayed as "Error decrypting message." The meta-data is correct but importing does not overwrite the password which I set while installing TextSecure.

report.summary: Distorted images on MMS messages.
report.label: bug
report.description: Greetings, Just to be short and sweet, whenever I attach a photo to my messages, it distorts the image. This happens with a portrait or landscape shot. I reliably see this on my G2X running Gingerbread, and on my new HTC One with Jelly Bean. I haven't tested sending video too much, but when I receive video it seems like a compressed low quality version. When I use the stock messaging apps on both phones, images send clear and undistorted. I can receive photo attachments just fine though. Thanks! .:Tory

report.summary: Clicking on entry in notification drawer does not open TextSecure
report.label: bug

In the past clicking on the TextSecure entry shown in the notification drawer would open TextSecure. That unfortunately no longer is the case after the switch.

report.summary: UI :: sent sms with link -> right click to this msg failed
report.label: bug
report.description: If i write an (unencrypted or encrypted) sms with the following link in the content Test - http://goo.gl/maps/900foo I get buggy behavioural while trying to select (right click) only this specific message. -> I'm simply not able to select it. TextSecure v0.9.9.8 from Market

report.summary: Some messages not displaying, stuck on "Decrypting, please wait"
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, I've got this problem regularly and the only way to view the message is to force close the app via the app manager and relaunch it. It's becoming very frustrating, please address the issue ASAP.

report.summary: TextSecure doesn't intercept key exchange messages when 'use for all sms' is unticked.
report.label: bug
report.description: I want to be able to make TextSecure the default handler for only encrypted texts sent from other TextSMS users. Reason #1 -- I like being able to automagically have my regular SMS messages backed up to teh Googlez. It seems like this could be resolved by giving SecureText an option to use the regular SMS database for unencrypted texts.. Reason #2 -- It's just not as glitzy and polished as the SMS app I usually use. If I could talk to the couple paranoid people in my life with this app and everyone else with my regular SMS app, that would great!

report.summary: MMS settings are checked for adding attachments but not group messages
report.label: bug
report.description: TextSecure sends group messages through an MMS in broadcast mode but does not check that MMS details are available either through ApnDefaults or the user defined Fallback MMSC settings. MMS availability is checked upon adding attachments to an SMS, the same should be done for group messages.

report.summary: recieving (generating?) random text messages
report.label: bug
report.description: For some time now, I have been recieving seemingly random text messages from TextSecure. The text of those messages have been similar to this: sisp:LDEn0NAoHCrvI0UqFKpkhA==:1:1https://mobselfcare.optusnet.com.au/;4444;61404075361;XUYOOdazySUSX52i9hltFT3RQ4xOKUpf I have been in contact with my service provider (Optus), who assure me that they are not generating this message and suggested that the program is doing it. When I received a message like this only when my phone powered on, I could live with this behaviour, but recently it has started recieving these messages on a roughly hourly basis, which is annoying to say the least. using the latest version through Google Play on Android 2.3.5 on a HTC Happy to be told this is not a bug, but include something about how I can switch it off - the last time this happened, I almost uninstalled the program, it was so annoying

report.summary: "Error sending message" when plaintext SMS over 160 characters.

report.description: Currently on AOKP by Team Kang (can't remember which version, flashed this ROM a few weeks ago. Still had this problem with the stock T-Mobile ROM, however.) T-mobile Galaxy S4 (M-919) I invoked the bug and here's a logcat: http://pastebin.com/qr46bumW

report.summary: Sub-identifier showing "Custom" instead of the Custom setting value
report.label: bug
report.description: When I have a contact in my list that has multiple numbers, those labels are enumerated like "Mobile 1" "Mobile 2" etc. When I read a text, it would be nice to see that sub-label as well in the case of multiple persons in one contact.

report.summary: Encrypted Export of Unencrypted Storage does weird things
report.label: bug
report.description: Basically, remove the password to your database, make an "encrypted export", import that export. You will have a password prompt that you cannot get past unless you force kill text secure, then the next time you start it the password prompt will not be there. I suspect there are a few solutions. The easiest is to disallow encrypted export of unencrypted data. An alternative is to prompt the user for a password when exporting unencrypted data (or maybe always?) Oh and of course the password prompt bug for unencrypted databases could go away :)

report.summary: receiving iPhone contact slows down/crashes TextSecure
report.label: bug
report.description: Whenever an iPhone user attempts to text me a contact from their phone (a "vcard" I believe) TextSecure grinds to a halt and invariably crashes. In order to resolve this, I have to delete the message thread that contains the contact. The contact comes in as a huge block of text. It might just be more data in one message than TextSecure expects. Currently running on a Galaxy SG3 with Cyanogenmod 10.2

report.summary: Group replies try to send to myself
report.label: bug
report.description: When I receive a group text from another phone also running TextSecure, it includes me in the recipient list. That is, the sender might see, "2 recipients in group" while I will see 3. When I reply, it fails, I assume, because it is trying to also send to myself. The third recipient looks like +1xxxyyyzzzz while the other recipients have their first names. Is there some setting that I'm missing where I can tell TextSecure my phone number so that it leaves it out of replies? I've tried making sure that "my" contact card in contacts/people has my phone number, including the leading "+1".

report.summary: LongClick on a URL doesn't work correctly
report.label: bug
report.description: If you send a text message that includes a URL and you have a default action specified for that protocol, the action is performed on the release instead of allowing you to choose an action from the context menu. For example, if you have a default browser and send the text: "Check out this website: http://www.google.ca" If you LongClick on the text (anywhere, not just on the URL), you will see the the context menu appear with 4 options, but as soon as you release, the browser will open. Pressing back from the browser does not allow you to select one of the context menu options. The only work around I've found is to use 2 fingers and choose the option you want with the other finger before the browser opens. If you don't have a default browser, you can hit back to open the context menu after the 'open with...' dialog appears. No other applications should be launched on a LongClick.

report.summary: Broken add contact functionality during chat session
report.label: bug
report.description: Phone: HTC One V Android: 4.0.3 HTC Sense: 4.0 TextSecure: latest (Play Store) In a chat session, if I press an unknown phone number's avatar in order to add them as a new contact, TextSecure displays a non-standard dialog box asking to add the phone number to contacts[1]. Pressing OK simply opens up the People app with no add contact screen for the new phone number[2]. This issue does not happen on the main TextSecure screen (list of conversations), where pressing the same avatar brings up the correct screen[3].

report.summary: edge case not covered when identities switch
report.label: bug
report.description: Phone A and B have registered themselves to use data channel. Phone B gets into some form of conversation with Phone A just to guarantee a session exists and Phone A is aware of Phone B's identity. Phone B deregisters, clears data, starts over again and reregisters to data channel. Phone B starts new group with Phone A as member. Phone A sees the new group, but also sees a separate conversation start with a click-to-confirm for the new identity. When you click to confirm, you get a dump of the encoded group action message as if it were a normal text.

report.summary: Unreadable Contact-Names in "Dark Theme"
report.label: bug
report.description: When choosing the dark theme: Text of all contacts stays black when trying to add someone to a conversation / send SMS for the first time. Names therefore nearly unreadable. Device: Galaxy S4 GT-I9505; OS: CM 10.2

report.summary: Dark Theme Uses Black Font on Dark Background
report.label: bug
report.description: In the most recent version (version 2.0) with the Dark Theme selected, the textbox that one types a message into uses a black font on a dark background. This makes it very hard to read while entering your message. Once you hit send, the text is shown with a white font, which is much easier to read. To increase readability, could we switch this font color to white while entering a text as well?

report.summary: multiple phone #'s in group text obscuring date sms was sent
report.label: bug
report.description: If I have a group text that has several different numbers on it and I'm in portrait view in the main thread (all texts by all users), the telephone numbers will over-lap the date at the end of the line, obfuscating both the last number and the date the message was sent.

report.summary: Alphanumeric addresses in SMS messages
report.label: bug
report.description: My carrier and some other companies sometimes send SMS with alphanumeric addresses. When TextSecure receives them, it shows sender as Anonymous. Also, it won't import them from system database (i. e. SMS will not show in TextSecure in any way). I have saved few such messages on my phone (Galaxy Nexus) and I know a tiny bit about Android development, so if there anything I can check/send to help resolve the issue, I will be glad to help.

report.summary: Contact's phone number will not be recognized by TextSecure
report.label: bug
report.description: I always save my phone numbers in the international format +49 ... (for Germany). I have one contact, where TextSecure will not recognize the + and therefore tries to send messages to an invalid number, which obviously will fail. I had this before the 2.0 update, but there it could be fixed by recreating the thread manually. This fix doesn't work with 2.0+ anymore, which is really annoying because I can't send messages/SMS to that contact.

report.summary: Limited video size?
report.label: bug
report.description: Seems that sending video files are limited in size... Don't know if it's pixel size or file size?!? IMHO there should be exist no size limit.

report.summary: Access through share menu accesses old contact selector which no longer works
report.label: bug
report.description: When sending a message through the share menu from another app the old contact picker is exposed with a list picker that doesn't do anything

report.summary: Group chat: Can't send message or leave group after being added a second time
report.label: bug

B now gets new group messages, but can't leave again or send any more messages to group. Happened to me on a Galaxy S4 with Android 4.3. I can delete the group thread, but it will appear again as soon as a new message is posted to the group.

report.summary: Larger font sizes make the conversation list cluttered since the layouts don't scale
report.label: bug
report.description: The heights of name/conversation should be relative to the system font size.

report.summary: passphrase timeout does not work
report.label: bug
report.description: AOSP 4.4.2 TextSecure 2.0.1 W/KeyCachingService( 4362): Decrementing activity count... W/KeyCachingService( 4362): Starting timeout: 180000 [...] W/ActivityManager( 627): Permission Denial: Accessing service ComponentInfo{org.thoughtcrime.securesms/org.thoughtcrime.securesms.service.KeyCachingService} from pid=-1, uid=10102 that is not exported from uid 10103

report.summary: Sent Data Messages Appear Green Before Turning Blue
report.label: bug
report.description: While pending data messages are being sent, they appear green before switching to blue. This causes ambiguity for the sender who isn't sure whether the last sent message was actually transmitted over data or SMS.

report.summary: First SMS sent went to incorrect recipient
report.label: bug
report.description: I set up TextSecure, then sent an SMS to (non-TS User) person A. I then got a reply from person B (also not a TextSecure user) "?". When I asked them what they were referring to, they explained they had received my first SMS intended for A. The SMS in question is still listed under the conversation with A and has never shown under the conversation list of person B in TextSecure. I have not tried to send an SMS with TextSecure since for obvious reasons, and have reverted back to my default SMS app (Hangouts) with which I have had no problems. Is there any kind of log I can provide to help with investigating this issue?

report.summary: Submit debug log fails
report.label: bug
report.description: If I try to submit a debug log, an error accurs: "Could not grab logs from your device. You can still use ADB to get debug logs instead." There are missing root/supersu rights to get acces to the logs. Tested on SlimROMs SlimBean 4.2.2 (Samsung Galaxy S2 i9100) and Samsung Stock Android 2.3.6 (Samsung Galaxy Ace Plus)

report.summary: get own number for registration no longer work
report.label: bug
report.description: just get the update from playstore (2.0.2), TextSecure do not show my own number if i want register for push. This worked fine with the version before this. cu

report.summary: Fake notification saying "Encrypted message"
report.label: bug
report.description: Every time I start the app I get a fake notification from a contact that also has TS with the italic text "Encrypted mesaage" and a time stamp of the current time. If I click on it it takes me to the conversation with that contact, but there is no new message. This happens every single time I open up the app after clearing it from recent apps. I do not have encrypted storage enabled. Edit: it seems that after doing this a few times it turned into a bad encrypted message. All messages I send to that contact show up as bad encrypted message. So do the ones I get from them.

report.summary: Message Duplication on Bad Connection
report.label: bug
report.description: A friend tries to chat with me but has low connectivity. This causes messages to be sent with a delay, of course. It seems like TS re-sends those messages after a while, but the first message still is "queued" somewhere and gets delivered, too. This way, I get the message twice (with different "sent" timestamps...).

report.summary: [UX] Long press doesn't block tap action
report.label: bug
report.description: Long pressing to bring up the context menu on individual messages does not block the short press action. For example: I sent a message to a friend which contained the https link to the TextSecure Play Store page and no other text. I then wanted to copy the message text to resend it to another friend. Long pressing on that message does bring up the context menu but it then activates the link and opens the Play Store app before the menu can be used.

report.summary: Encrypted Backup: Password wrong?
report.label: bug
report.description: I just did an encrypted backup, deinstalled and re-installed TextSecure and tried to re-import the backup again. After that, I could not unlock TS, it kept telling me my password was wrong. Luckily, I also did a backup using Helium (the backup tool from ClockworkMod). Restoring this backup helped (so I can be sure my password was correct all the time)...

report.summary: App crashes when I browse the emoticons
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, everytime I scroll through the emoticons, I get a error message and the app crashes.

report.summary: TextSecure doesn't display MMS pictures
report.label: bug
report.description: I received a picture via MMS, but TextSecure doesn't display it. If I touch the broken image icon, it will display the image in an external viewer.

report.summary: Not displaying message until app restart
report.label: bug
report.description: I ran into the following situation: phone vibrates and LED flashes green (=> Textsecure) There's a notification, I click it to open TextSecure. However, there is no new message available in the app. I killed TextSecure and restarted it and the message is now displayed. I think I ran into this one or two times before already. TextSecure 2.0.3 on Android 4.4.2 (Nexus 5).

report.summary: Feature request: pre-populate the "Your Phone Number" dialog at install time
report.label: bug
report.description: When someone first launches the app, he quickly gets to the dialog "Connect with TextSecure". That dialog asks for: your country, your country code and phone number. It would be great if: if we got rid of the "country" or "country code". One of the 2 should be enough. these could be automatically populated so that one just needed to confirm that these were correct. I believe that Android provides a way to query for the local phone number.

report.summary: Changing the group picture spawns an empty notification
report.label: bug
report.description: Consider the following situation: Alice invites Bob to a 2-people group. Later, Alice changes the group picture. Expected behaviour: The group chats reads "Alice has changed the group picture." The message looks similar to "xyz has joined the group chat." Actual behaviour: Bob receives a notification reporting an empty message from Alice. Just a little something I noticed.

report.summary: Flash SMS don't arrive
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello Running TextSecure 2.0.3 on Android 4.3 (Samsung Galaxy Nexus GSM), stock Android. I do not receive any flash SMS, f.e. login codes for my online banking. I verified this issue with Hangouts and stock SMS app, both apps receive flash SMS. Any ideas?

report.summary: Long-Pressing an image should open the standard message actions popup
report.label: bug
report.description: When long-pressing an image, the dialog confirming whether I want to temporarily save it without encryption to open is shown. This is inconsistent, I believe the standard message long-press actions popup should be shown instead (Copy text / Delete message / Message Details / Forward message).

report.summary: Error notification popup stays open forever.
report.label: bug
report.description: I just wrote a message to a group and lost my wifi connection. After I hit 'send', a notification popup was shown telling me that the SMS could not be delivered and that it will be sent later. The message was delivered via push eventually, but the popup obscured the screen, even after switching to another app and swiping TS from the app list. Unfortunately I did not try to force quit TS but rebooted my phone. TS 2.0.4 All recipients in the group and myself are registered for push. Here's the error log: http://hastebin.com/cufowigeje This happened once before in 2.0.0.

report.summary: Image flickers during send
report.label: bug
report.description: I just wrote a message to a group and lost my wifi connection. After I hit 'send', an image shown in a message above started flickering rapidly. The flickering only stopped after the message was eventually delivered. Could it be the case that the image is repeatedly redrawn with each attempt to send the message?

report.summary: Disable SMS fallback on 4.3
report.label: bug
report.description: Hey, I'm on 2.0.4, on JB/4.3, and the "Disable SMS fallback" option is always grayed out. As I've found no definitive answer on how to change the default messaging app in 4.3 I've tried toggling SMS in Hangouts, installing other SMS apps such as EvolveSMS (which says it overwrites the default behaviour), reinstalling TextSecure - all to no avail. How am I supposed to achieve being able to turn SMS fallback off?

report.summary: [RFE] Emphasize the TS supported phone numbers
report.label: bug
report.description: When starting a new conversation (TextSecure menu > "+"), the list of my contacts is presented ("Select Contact"), the TextSecure supported contacts shown with a green bar. The phone number presented in this view for each contact seems to be just the first of all phone numbers for this person listed in (and imported from) my phone's directory. Choosing one of the TS supported entries, the full list of phone numbers (home, fax, work, work fax, mobile1, mobile2 etc.) for this contact is presented for choice. (See also #1011 and #990.) Unfortunately, there is no indicator for which of these numbers (for example, in the case of more than one mobile phone number) a contact key is stored. It is also not possible to check the phone number in TextSecure > Contact Keys > Manage Identity Keys as only the name of the contact is shown but not the specific phone number associated with it. I would like to suggest that the TS supported phone number should be emphasized (marked by a green bullet or something similar).

report.summary: Broken group chat, no participants, cannot leave or write?
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a group chat with several other people, including @tyll, all running TextSecure 2.0.4. He sees no group details, the list of participants is empty and he cannot leave or write a message. On his phone, messages to the group are displayed in a group thread and he can decrypt the messages. No group avatar is displayed, the name is 'unknown group'. We both can exchange direct messages just fine. Maybe this is caused by missing the initial group creation message (all particpants at that time running 2.0.3)? How can users fix this, as there is no possibility to leave this empty group? Only by abandoning that group and creating a new one?

report.summary: group notifications in notification drawer just shows the sender not the group name
report.label: bug
report.description: when i get a group message it always just shows the sender in the notification drawer instead of a combination with the group name. at your daily business you maybe don't want to tap for every update in your group discussions, but you want to answer your private chats. at the moment you can not differentiate between private and group messages at your notification drawer. this is how it looks like at the moment: and something like that would be awesome ;-)

report.summary: hastebin debug logs disappearing too fast
report.label: bug
report.description: It seems at the moment debug logs on hastebin.com are being deleted after only a few days. This makes analyzing bug reports much more difficult. Should we switch the upload to go to anonymous github gists? It can also be done with a simple POST request: curl --data '{"description":"Created via API","public":"true","files":{"file1.txt":{"content":"Demo"}}' https://api.github.com/gists

report.summary: After restore: Groups are completely broken! - Getting messages, can't leave, can't write!
report.label: bug
report.description: The bug: I deleted all my data from Textsecure while I was in a group and registered again with the same number. After that, I get the messages of the old group which is just unknown since then and I can't leave or write to this group. It's showing that there aren't any members in the group. My mates can't kick me from the group either. This is how the bug was caused: I joined a group, made an encrypted backup, deleted all data of the app, restarted it and restored the backup. The restore failed, all messages were broken. I still get messages of the group, the group is unknown, I can't leave or join the group, but receive all messages they send. Suggestion: Let me see which groups I joined with my number and let me leave them (even if I restored!) üëç 7

report.summary: unencrypted export crahes App
report.label: bug
report.description: trying to export the Massagen unencrypted to SD crahes TextSecure every time. Encrypted export works finde.

report.summary: Old messages merged with new messages
report.label: bug
report.description: I received a message which began as a SMS message that I received a long time ago. It sounded familiar. But then, somewhere in the middle, the SMS message changed (content, tone, etc). I copied the text and the sender told me that message is not what was sent by her. Somehow, the message was corrupted with an older SMS message. Debug log: http://hastebin.com/suguwokomo

report.summary: Forwarded SMS not being encrypted when not touching text
report.label: bug
report.description: It's just a little "bug": When i forward a message and don't change the text or touch the text field, an outgoing SMS isn't beeing encrypted to a suitable recipient. Forwarded Messages over the data channel are fine.

report.summary: pt_BR L10n actually using pt_PT L10n
report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed that when I configure TextSecure to use the pt_BR (Brazil) localization, it actually uses the pt_PT (Portugal) localization. As an example, look at the string "Language" in the settings menu. pt_PT translation = "L√≠ngua" pt_BR translation = "Idioma" (but appears "L√≠ngua")

report.summary: Sending SMS takes some time
report.label: bug
report.description: When pressing the SEND button to send an sms (unencrypted in my case) it takes some time until I can type again into the message field. Is it possible to improve this behaviour? If not already used, use AsyncTask for example.

report.summary: Attachment reselection
report.label: bug
report.description: When I select an attachment and without sending select another one, then the second attachment is shown before sending, but the first one is sent (received at the other device) and displayed (at my device) after I sent the message.

report.summary: Rename 'push' to something non-technical
report.label: bug
report.description: Since there is no issue for this yet and it has popped up across several other issues, we should discuss this. I think that "data" would be a good replacement in the U.S. language. In the U.S., people explicitly pay for "data", so they know what that is. In German for example, this should be translated with "Internet", though, since no one here would use the word "Daten" for mobile internet. So I guess this is at least partly language-dependent.

report.summary: Updating group title/adding members deletes group picture
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I am sorry if this was already filed as a bug, but I searched and did not find it. Currently it seems as though updating a group (the title or by adding another member) deletes the image that was set for the group, unless I specifically select the same image again. Is anyone else experiencing this problem?

report.summary: Problem with multiple SIM card
report.label: bug
report.description: TextSecure have a problem when the SIM card ( or the phone number ) is changed. The fallback SMS transport does not work anymore and any message received from the user having changed his SIM card appear as "invalid encrypted message". Scenario to reproduce User A and User B User A send start conv with both "Push" and "SMS" transport with B Everything works fine User A change its phone number User A send message to B with "Push" method -> Everything works fine User B send message to User A with "Push" method -> Everything works fine User A send message to B with SMS fallback method -> User B receive Alien messages impossible to read Nor ending the secured session for one or the other user seems to work. Adev

report.summary: International data groups. Unidentified problem.
report.label: bug
report.description: Alice is in Ireland. Bob is in Colombia. Carol is in the UK. They resolve to use Text Secure because SMS is too expensive. They all appear to register their numbers successfully, and all of them successfully begin to use push messages. Alice (or Carol) start a new group and add the others. Alice can see both Bob's and Carol's messages, and can send messages to the group, which appear to be sent. Bob can see both Alice's and Carol's messages, and can send messages to the group, which appear to be sent. Carol can see Alice's messages, but cannot see Bob's messages, and whenever she sends messages to the group, they appear to be sent. They try to message each other individually. Alice can message both Bob and Carol. Carol can message both Bob and Alice. Bob can message Alice, but cannot message Carol. His messages don't arrive, even though they appear to have sent. None of them really understand what could be going wrong at the protocol level.

report.summary: sms characters remaining don't account for encoding
report.label: bug
report.description: When composing a new message, the number of required SMSes are calculated based on the type of characters (Cyrillic or Latin) used in the first message of the thread rather than on the characters used for composition. 1 SMS = 60 Cyrillic or 160 Latin characters.

report.summary: I get their messages, but they don't get my ones
report.label: bug
report.description: Trying to switch family members from WhatApps -- bummer: I get their messages, and I can send off messages to them, but they do not get my messages. I remember when setting up the app on their phones I did not set a password to protect the local message base, but I did so when setting up the app on my phone. Probably more important difference is that I am on a Dual-SIM Huawei (with second SIM currently switched off though) while their Samsung phones are all single-SIM. So far, I have tested only on wlan (yes, when setting up TextSecure on all phones, I "registered" the phone no of the active SIM card, so all phones should be able to use wlan, not just SMS). Any idea what I could do so they get my messages? Thank you! -mgkai

report.summary: MMS Preferences not saved?
report.label: bug
report.description: Hey, first of all thank you very much for your effort of developing such a great app! For my installation of TextSecure (2.0.5 on Android 4.3) it seems that the on/off-Switch to override system MMS settings does not work. Speaking for my particular case: if I enter the "MMS Preferences" Section the checkbox is checked. I may uncheck the box and return to the main menu. If I then go to "MMS Preferences" again, the checkbox is still checked (so it seems as if the change was not saved). In addition, I may not uncheck the checkbox again but reveice the following notification instead: "Manual MMS settings are required for your phone." If I return to the main menu AGAIN and go to the "MMS Preferences" Section again, I may uncheck the checkbox... still, it does not seem to be the case that my changes are saved. Sidenote: changing the MMSC URL, MMS Proxy Host and MMS Proxy Port seems to work - at least the values entered are still there once I re-enter the section. Thanks for your support - I hope my description is precise enough to be of help.

Still trying to reproduce this...

report.summary: in landscape mode the send button does not indicate encryption
report.label: bug
report.description: observed behavior: When flipping the phone while composing a TextSecure message such that landscape mode gets activated, the send button does not indicate whether the message will be secured. (I.e. a gray button with the text 'Send' is displayed.) When not typing (no keyboard displayed), everything is fine. expected behavior: A colored send button with a padlock indicating whether the message will be encrypted is displayed while typing. (Just as when not in landscape mode.) possible solutions: Can TextSecure modify the Android landscape keyboard? If yes, then the send button should be adapted. If not, maybe collapse the keyboard instead of sending when in landscape mode? That way, the TextSecure send button would be displayed (and would have to be pressed to actually send the message). While not ideal, this should at least avoid accidentally sending unencrypted messages.

report.summary: In dark theme, text too dark when starting new conversation from "+"
report.label: bug
report.description: Enable Dark Theme Press "+" to start new conversation a. Notice that "TEXTSECURE USERS" and "ALL CONTACTS" text is still very dark. b. Even text showing the contact names and numbers are fairly dark still. Should probably be a fair amount brighter for all the text and lines between things. Using Galaxy S4, Auto dimming.

report.summary: Some (minor) group UI issues
report.label: bug
report.description: wrong ActionBar title: open an existing group select update group ActionBar correct title: "Update Group: some groupname" leave the activity by locking the screen, adding a member or adding an avatar when you return to the group settings the action bar title now is: "New Group" The default group avatar is not circle cropped, in the settings activity. Edit: fixed many commits ago Edit 2: unfixed lately Leaving the group settings with the check mark - without effectively changing something (name, members, avatar) - leads to a group update broadcast. This is distracting for the receivers when nothing has changed. Group conversation recipients dialog allows tapping a contact to highlight it shortly. is there any reason for that? Planned features maybe? fixed An avatar can not be changed back to default

Both myself and my wife have observed this issue. I'm running version 2.0.7 on a CM11 nightly build on my Nexus 5. She is running the same app version and vanilla KitKat 4.4 on her Nexus 4.

report.summary: Log is leaking phone number
report.label: bug
report.description: As already mentioned by @tinloaf in WhisperSystems#1351 (comment) the phone number is leaked in PushServiceSocket.java makeBaseRequest. The line Log.w("PushServiceSocket", method + " -- " + body); leaks the recipient number to the a log entry like: 3834-3856/org.thoughtcrime.securesms W/PushServiceSocketÔπï PUT -- {"destination":"+4XXXXXXXXXXX","messages":[{"body":"IgohB ... Isn't this affected by the wiki entry "Be careful what you log!"? Maybe Log.w("DatabaseFactory", "Updated body: " + body + " and part_count: " + partCount); in DatabaseFactory.java onApplicationLevelUpgrade() is also affected. Didn't test.

report.summary: App fails to recognise correct password after phone dies until quit and reopened
report.label: bug
report.description: My phone died earlier today, and once I had my phone connected to power and back on I found that TextSecure would not accept my password. I tried entering it more than a dozen times, and even tried copy+pasting the password from a text editor. Eventually, I did a bit of googling, and the comment WhisperSystems#190 (comment) made me think to quit and reopen the app. I removed the app from my app switcher, opened a task manager to ensure it had quit, and then reopened the app. It then accepted my password on my first try. Perhaps the commenters in that thread were having the same issue, but failed to identify it properly? (Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini GT-I8190N running latest firmware from Vodafone, Android 4.1.2)

report.description: http://hastebin.com/bilesucove Got a group message from several people (mix of text secure, iphone, and other android users). If I use the drop down notifications to click on the message, the app crashes and I have to enter my password again. If I open up the conversation list, and click on the unread message, everything works fine. ATT galaxy s4 android 4.4.2

report.summary: [Bug ?] Key changed events do not generate a notification
report.label: bug
report.description: I encountered this with a friend of mine who reflashed his phone and subsequently reregistered. I had an ongoing chat (using his old key) with him and noticed today that he had sent me a message yesterday and I had to accept the new key. But I didn't get notified about the new message in the notification bar I would expect Textsecure to generate notifications for all events including the key changed event, since this may lead to unnoticed messages, depending on usage pattern of course. If this behaviour is intentional, it would be great to know the rationale behind this. Anyways I want to thank you for your amazing work! Steps to reproduce: User A and User B both register with Textsecure Both Users exchange a couple of messages User B reregisters with Textsecure changing his key User B send User A a Message No notification is shown on User A's device Expected behaviour: User A should be notified of the incoming message with the new key

report.summary: Bad encrypted message...
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, A friend and I are using TextSecure 2.0.8. I'm running Android 4.4.2 and he's running 4.3. We've exchanged dozen of encrypted messages in the past and everything worked fine. A few days ago, I sent him a message with an image and he replied. It worked as expected. Then I replied with a text message. It was sent as a regular SMS, the bubble color was green. (I was in a place with very bad 3G signal). Instead of receiving the message I sent him, he received a key icon, then a couple of hours later, what looks like encrypted text : He then sent me a message that appeared to be sent correctly from his side (blue bubble, nothing special), but appeared as "Bad encrypted message..." from my side. I replied him, the message appeared to have been sent correctly from my side (blue bubble, nothing special), but he received a "Bad encrypted message..." too. From this moment, all the messages we exchange are received as "Bad encrypted message...". Here are his logs and mine : https://gist.github.com/tbalthazar/7afe026443ee266cb4fb Please let me know if you need more info. Cheers, Thomas.

report.summary: After Crash Wrong Password Allowed Entry
report.label: bug
report.description: One time, after TextSecure crashed then I immediately reopened it, it asked me for my password, then when I entered the wrong password it still opened like I had entered the right password. I'm sure the password was wrong. This could have been because the password was cached already even though TextSecure thought it wasn't. I don't know.

report.summary: SMS number always taken from contacts
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a somehow special setup. As I use my mobile phone for business and private contacts I do not send my number when calling in general. So I have switched that off. For people that should see it's me calling them I have added the *31# GSM code in their phone number in the contacts so that my number is shown to them. (I do this because I have to take hotline calls from time to time and calling them back should not show my number). I now tried using TextSecure and found that when I type in a number that's in my contacts (and I type the number without the *31#) TextSecure automatically finds it and takes the number with the GSM code in front of it. Thus no SMS ever gets send because the taken number does not work on SMS. Would be great to have the GSM code filtered away, thus I could use the Contacts (which is also not possible with the standard SMS app with my setup) fully or at least just take the number I've typed into without looking it up further (this is how the standard app behaves). If there is any more information needed just let me know. kr Tom

report.summary: strange menu item text
report.label: bug
report.description: there is "Get scanned to compare" (just below "Scan to compare") which was not understandable to me (as a non-native speaker, but I suspect native speaker might have issues, too). suggestion: show QR code (to compare)

report.summary: Can't copy message text if link is occurrence
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I found a nice bug, when message is occurring the URL it can't be copied. Instead of this message it will be last, or previously one copied. Example: A: Hi, how are B: Fine, thx. Check this out http://google.com B: How is the weather? B: Bye! So, I tried to copy first message with the link, it will be copied second, or third one, but not the link or message with it.

report.summary: Date and time not readable in Dark Theme
report.label: bug
report.description: The date and timestamp is not easily readable in the darktheme, because the text is too dark. It' grey on dark grey, green on dark green or blue on dark blue. Esp. on displays with high resolution (full hd), it is to small to read with this little contrast.

report.summary: Cannot send MMS messages - Brazil/carrier Oi
report.label: bug
report.description: I can receive MMS messages from other TextSecure users but I can't send MMS messages back to them. The messages I try to send get flagged with a red exclamation mark and the error message "Error sending message". This happens the moment I press the send button, as if the app didn't even try to establish a connection to send the message. Carrier: Oi (Brazil) Push and SMS Settings: Push messages: On Incoming SMS: Disabled Allow outgoing SMS to: Nobody SMS delivery reports: Off Debug log: http://hastebin.com/jupunopuqo Let me know if there's any other useful information I can provide. Thank you

report.summary: off-by-x in message deletion
report.label: bug
report.description: I have noticed (through several TextSecure versions running on Android 4.1.x and now 4.2.2) that if I select the second-last message in certain threads and delete it, it will reliably delete the last message instead. If I scroll up to the top and try to delete the first message, it'll delete some message below, but not the second. Same with trying to delete the second message. It doesn't happen in all threads. I have one huge thread from "Anonymous" (various services that send messages from names like "LM-VODAFONE", for which the sender shows up in TextSecure as "Unknown" in "Message details"), and that's where I've noticed it most often. I realise this is a rather vague report, but I'd be happy to try and help with debugging if anyone has ideas for things I should try.

report.summary: Can't end secure session
report.label: bug
report.description: So, I sent my friend an unencrypted SMS message. For whatever reason, TextSecure crashed and restarted. When I logged in, I tried to respond to him, and found that suddenly he was secure (blue messages/arrow). I'm not sure how, since he wasn't before. I haven't confirmed to make sure that he's using the app, but I don't think he is. Sending him a few messages (encrypted) failed. When I try to end the secure session, I got an error (the triangle icon): Secure session ended. report.summary: Back Stack Issues
report.label: bug
report.description: If I click back on a message, I often see the same message multiple times. A single message should only be in the back stack once. Also after clicking a notification, clicking back should return you to your previous app, now cycle you through all activity of TextSecure.

report.summary: Correct password won't be accepted if it contains special characters
report.label: bug
report.description: I have noticed a strange behavior of Text secure on Android 4.2 and 4.3.1 which seems to be reproducable. A certainly correct password was not accepted by textsecure this happened not only to me but also to an acquaintance of mine. Both passwords ckntakned special charakters Like √§√º√∂¬•œÄ#.. Both devices are Samsung Galaxy s4 minis

report.summary: MMS Issue / Image switching
report.label: bug
report.description: having issues? better go somewhere else.. mods don't care. üôà something about receiving an image in the wrong conversation, claims that it wasn't just the image preview was wrong but the image itself was wrong.

report.summary: Notification bar leads to black screen
report.label: bug
report.description: When tapping a text message notification, a black screen comes up instead of the TextSecure app. I've tried rebooting and closing all open apps. Device: Samsung Galaxy S4 (Sprint) running stock Android 4.42 L720VPUFNAE Debug log: http://hastebin.com/ageyocihog

report.summary: New User - Bad encrypted message...
report.label: bug
report.description: Testing secure sessions with myself as the sender and receiver, unsecure messages work fine but during a secure session I receive "Bad encrypted message..." as well as the red error triangle. Also, when ending the secure session, I receive "Message encrypted for non-existing session..." http://hastebin.com/dakemaluze

report.summary: Can not download MMS (Czech Rep., O2)
report.label: bug
report.description: When I try to download contents of a MMS, I always get a failure to reach the server. The log is here: http://hastebin.com/piveravogo The phone is configured according to operator: http://www.o2.cz/osobni/techzona-mobilni-telefony/296276-samsung_i8190_galaxy_s_iii_mini.html?article=297753 (when I tried to enter the same values to respective settings in TextSecure, there was no change) I didn't have any issues with MMS receiving before I switched to TextSecure.

report.summary: MMS doesn't work unless you enter override settings
report.label: bug
report.description: Well it's as the title says, I only realised this after searching Google. That's a terrible thing. FYI, I had to enter http://mmsc.t-mobile.co.uk:8002 149.254.201.135 8080

report.summary: Empty notification when receiving an image without text
report.label: bug
report.description: Sorry if this was already reported somewhere, didn't find anything using the search. I just noticed that when you receive an image without any text in a message, the belonging notification just displays the sender but nothing else. WhatsApp solves this by displaying "John Doe - Picture", so that you know what's going on. This probably concerns the other attachment types as well (didn't test it though). My suggest would be to follow the example of WhatsApp and just display the type of the received media.

report.summary: Images get mixed/lost between senders
report.label: bug
report.description: I've had an ongoing issue where I'll receive an image in a text message, but it will display as an image I had already received from another sender. The new image just never displays. Contact A sends me a picture of her kids. I can view it. Contact B sends me a picture, but the thumbnail is the same as the image from Contact A. I touch it to open it in my pictures. It opens as the picture from Contact A. Contact C sends me a picture. It comes through normally. Contact A sends another picture. It comes through as the picture from Contact C. Also, I've noticed that if someone sends a picture to a group, 99% of the time I get no thumbnail (just an empty box), and a "Media not Found" error when I try to open it.

report.summary: Received corrupted key exchange message!
report.label: bug
report.description: I experienced this Problem with two Contacts in my List. They are unable to send me messages. Instead i get: "Received corrupted key exchange message!" and so do they, when I try to send a message to them. Ending the Secure Session via the Lock Symbol didn't change the Situation. This behavior started some time after I switched from Cyanogenmod 10 to Cyanogenmod 11 with a Factory Reset. But all other TextSecure Contacts except the two mentioned, kept working fine. I also refreshed the Push Directory several Times after the Error started to appear but it didn't change anything. Device Info: Nexus S, CyanogenMod 11-20140608-SNAPSHOT-M7-crespo

report.summary: Member kicked from group, can post but not receive group messages
report.label: bug
report.description: I've been using a group message with two other TS users successfully for about a week. Today, one member appeared to leave the group. They could still send to the group and from their side, it looked like they were still in the group, but from both other participants, no messages were going through to the third person (K in the images). Messages from K to the group were seen by all, but messages from B and J were not delivered to K. Creating new groups with both the same and different participants had the same effect. K would leave the group upon sending of the first message from B or J. Screenshots are from B. K is using a HTC One X (ATT) with Android 4.1.1, HTC Sense version 4+, HTC SDK API 4.63. Here's K's log: http://hastebin.com/yimowizopu B is using Samsung Galaxy S4 (ATT) Android 4.4.2 Here's B's log: http://hastebin.com/pinojanive

report.summary: Timeout interval not working in 2.1.1
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a Galaxy Note 3 running Kit Kat and recently updated to TextSecure v2.1.1. I have the app set to timeout the passphrase at five minutes. Since the update, if I leave the app unlocked, it will not ask for the passphrase even after remaining unlocked for hours. Manual lock works fine, so it's something wrong in the timeout.

report.summary: Messages in group chats delivered multiple times
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, I have a problem with group chats. When I send messages in a group, some of the receipients get the same message multiple times, for apparently no reason. Is this a known bug? Is there a fix?

report.summary: MMS Crash Report
report.label: bug
report.description: Most frequent crash in the Play console right now: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:200) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:274) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:125) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:308) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019) Caused by: java.security.InvalidParameterException: mccmnc must not be null at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.database.ApnDatabase.getMmsConnectionParameters(ApnDatabase.java:98) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.mms.MmsCommunication.getLocalMmsConnectionParameters(MmsCommunication.java:76) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.mms.MmsCommunication.getMmsConnectionParameters(MmsCommunication.java:129) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.mms.MmsSendHelper.hasNecessaryApnDetails(MmsSendHelper.java:142) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.ConversationActivity$8.doInBackground(ConversationActivity.java:739) at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.ConversationActivity$8.doInBackground(ConversationActivity.java:736) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:185) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:306) ... 4 more

report.summary: mms photo thumbnail blank
report.label: bug
report.description: got an mms from an iphone user, the preview is blank, upon clicking and extracting it, it displays in an external viewer just fine. log: http://hastebin.com/icusokotoj

report.summary: SMS from non-numeric sender showing push availability
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, i received a SMS from a anonymous/non-numeric sender (like "sender") and TextSecure is showing me the blue send button for secure messaging in the conversation. The two options on long press are push and insecure sms. How can a non-numeric sender id be registered with the push service? Or is it a bug?

report.summary: MMS MSISDN/Line1 headers missing
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm new to using TextSecure and I'm sorry if this is a dupe but I couldn't find a similar issue. I just made TextSecure my default messaging app and when trying to download an MMS image, I receive "Error connecting to MMS provider..." I used the following manual MMS settings, as found in my phone's system menu (##3282#): MMSC URL: http://mmsc.vmobl.com:8088 MMS Proxy Host: 68.28.31.2 MMS Proxy Port: 80 A debug log can be found at http://hastebin.com/idofelenev I think the log cut off the attempt to download MMS with the proxy, but in previous attempts it looked similar. Virgin Mobile US, Android 4.4.2, TextSecure 2.1.8

report.summary: Performance issues w/ long running chats
report.label: bug
report.description: I have recently imported old chatlogs and now have a contact for which the chatlog spans several years. When opening the chatview of that contact there is a noticable delay. Also when sending and receiving messages (it's the only contact where I can see the "encrypted message"-placeholder now and then). I use a Moto G (Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7, 1GB RAM). When exporting the plaintext chatlog it's 4MB in size and contains about 7500 messages for that contact.

report.summary: Search doesnt find groups
report.label: bug
report.description: Groups that are visible in the regular conversations view are not found when searching for their names. Its probably the same issue that has been pointed out here http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/8473126-can-t-see-send-to-groups I am quite sure that this was not the case back in July. If I recall correctly then it was also possible to find the groups in the contacts screen (the one that pops up when hitting +). Device info: HTC Desire HD, Cyanogenmod 7.3, TextSecure 2.1.8

report.summary: reading conversations during phone call not possibly
report.label: bug
report.description: In older version (can't say precisely up to which one) I could look into conversations during a phone call (with activated speaker). Now I can open the overview of Textsecure, but when I click on a conversation, nothing happens.

report.summary: Updating directory for new textsecure users only displays after leaving screen
report.label: bug
report.description: When updating directory new users, the screen does not refresh with new text-secure users. Leaving and re-entering the new text scree updates the list of users as expected.

report.summary: Encrypted MMS aren't in standardized SMIL format
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm suspecting this is why encrypted MMS is having problems on certain carriers like Vodafone while unencrypted does not.

report.summary: MMS BUG free mobile (Illiad, Free.fr)
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello ! I can't open my MMS that receive. My configuration is : And my error log is : http://hastebin.com/itoyanuyel My Provider is FreeMobile (subsidiary of Free.fr, subsidiary of illiad, french enterprise). Think you.

report.summary: Attempt to Connect to MMS Server Throws 501 Not Implemented Followed by No Route to Host
report.label: bug
report.description: When attempting to download an MMS message from T-Mobile, I receiving an error downloading message dialog. I receive the same dialog whether on wifi or cellular and whether using the APN defined or a manual defined server. My logs are available below. http://hastebin.com/izehagazek Please let me know what other information, I can provide to help debug the issue.

report.summary: Can‚Äôt enable push messages
report.label: bug
report.description: ISSUE: On one of three phones of our family, Text Secure (TS) is not working: First, after setting-up TS it connected to push-messages however, phone could only communicate with another phone with secure message in one direction (sending) but couldn‚Äôt receive from any of the other two. Checked to use number with country code, enabled Gapps, rebooted; no luck. Tried to disable push-messages and received error: ‚ÄúError connecting to server!‚Äù Deinstalled TS and reinstalled it again. Now, the phone cannot register with TS at all. Registration fails, because phone does not receive any sms with the required code from TS server, instead error message appears with something like "Network connectivity error ..." and TS recommends registration with call message. When doing it, registration code is noted and when enter, TS tells us "Network connectivity error ..." and registration fails. Updated to latest TS 2.1.9 and still the same issue. I‚Äôve reported it on Support Centre here: http://support.whispersystems.org/customer/portal/questions/8356686-can-t-disable-push-messages-un-register-from-textsecure- And was asked to post it on issue tracker. DEVICE INFO: First used TS 2.1.6, updated to TS 2.1.9, Nexus4, Android KitKat 4.4.4 CONNECTION: Data (like the other two phones, which do work) APP STATE: Default settings DEBUG LOG: Issue on TS 2.1.9: http://hastebin.com/qinudigafi Issue on TS 2.1.6: http://hastebin.com/quzuvigugi

report.summary: Duplicate "ALL CONTACTS" Contacts
report.label: bug
report.description: I've noticed that all of my non-TS contacts are duplicated in the app, ie: ALL CONTACTS. Each contact is listed twice. I'm also using Flock, if that makes any difference.

report.summary: App toast message continuous and seems not be ended.
report.label: bug
report.description: The SmsReceiver_currently_unable_to_send_your_sms_message message is toast continuous if the wifi network is connected without internet access or the network is unstable. it toasts the message all the time while we are in a group conversation, besides that all the members will received many repeated messages if you do not force stop the app. if (systemStateListener.isConnected()) scheduleQuickRetryAlarm(); seems systemStateListener.isConnected() return true but have no internet access.

report.summary: Readability of group creation message
report.label: bug
report.description: There is a small text in the ConversationActivity after creating a group. At the moment (after changes regarding AppCompat It think) it's not easily readable with white text on the light-grey background. I think it should be changed back to dark grey like before.

report.summary: Menu in English although UI set to another language
report.label: bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce: set language to non-english (tested in Slovenian and Deutsch) go to menu/my identity key/scan to compare go back to messages click menu - the menu is in English (temporarily)

report.summary: double/echo message tone - when inside the app
report.label: bug
report.description: I've messaged my friend... closed TS and waited for the reply.. Single standard message tone Replied and left the application open viewing the previous messages... double/echoed message tone.. It sounds really really interesting.. so feature?

report.summary: sending sms possible when sms disabled in existing conversation
report.label: bug
report.description: In the version 2.3.2, When we choose the settings to allow outgoing SMS to check the options: Text Secure users or Non-Text Secure Users. I choose only the text secure users and sends message to other party without having the text secure application and the other party was able to receive the message. Device: Nexus 5 Android Version 5.0 lollipop

report.summary: MMS are sent despite denied permission
report.label: bug
report.description: I have experienced this issue several times in the last few days and was able to reproduce it. I have only experienced and verified this issue with messages containing pictures, text-only messages seem to work as expected (apart from not beeing resent automatically via push when internet connectivity comes back, but that's a different issue). System: Android 4.1 rooted Samsung stock ROM TS 2.3.2 TS settings: Push messages: enabled Receive all SMS: enabled Receive all MMS: enabled Allow outgoing SMS to: TextSecure users: enabled Ask before sending SMS: enabled Non-TextSecure users: enabled Witnessed behaviour: When trying to send a picture on a spotty connection, TextSecure fails to send it via push and asks to tap the message to fall back to MMS. I tap the message and click no when asked if it should fall back. The message then shows the red triangle with the matching text that the message could not be sent. I now select the message and go to details -> resend message. TextSecure does not show the "please tap message to fall back" dialog again, instead the message stays in the failed state with the red triangle. When the internet connection comes back, the message is sent via MMS Expected behaviour: If the internet connection is still not available TextSecure should ask for permission to fall back to MMS once again, as it does with text messages. To reproduce: disable wifi+mobile data follow the above procedure from step 2 to 5 enable wifi+mobile data again you might have to wait several minutes or select the message and choose resent instead Log: https://hastebin.com/ipogomogov.vhdl I have another log ready if needed, but I'd have to scrub this one first. I consider this a serious bug because it can lead to rather significant unexpected costs as MMS are rather expensive (at least in Europe) and even more expensive if you are roaming.

report.summary: Wrongly displays "Error sending message" in groupchat.
report.label: bug
report.description: When I send a message in this groupchat it SOMETIMES displays "Error sending message". If I then check the details of the message it shows that it tried sending by MMS. However the other people in the groupchat do receive the message and do so as a push message. In the TextSecure settings I have SMS completely disabled (and so by extension also MMS). My TextSecure version is 2.3.2. I have an Cyanogenmod rom installed. This is the link to the part of my logcat where I tried sending a message in the groupchat that I got by adb (I deleted the phone numbers): https://gist.github.com/lamade10/29b322679d2f1260ab71

report.summary: Group message issues after device change
report.label: bug
report.description: Recently as I got a new phone, I experienced some issues with group messaging. As I cannot say, how far they are related, I'll just describe, what happened. First of all did a backup of the messages on the old phone. Tried to unregister push on the old phone. This didn't work with some rather generic error message (something like "unable to perform task" or so, don't remember exactly). Installed Textsecure on the new phone, registered for push. Imported backup from the old phone. So far, so good. The hassle began, when the first group message arrived. The message is shown in a conversation named "Unknown group". There's no way for me to change the group name or even leave the group to be readded. After someone else has added me to the group a second time (although I was already part of the group according to his phone), I can see the group name and receive messages ‚Äì but only from the one who readded me. Messages from other members are not shown. However, now I can leave the group. After being readded again, I can now receive all messages from any group member again.

report.summary: Phantom push message notifications on text secure lock
report.label: bug
report.description:
Over the past week or so, I have been getting phantom push message notifications. By phantom, I mean an "encrypted message" notification appears, but then the are no new messages after I unlock text secure. Initially there was only one phantom message, a day it two later there were two, now there are six. They seem to appear shortly after time text secure locks itself. Edit: Have confirmed that the phantom notification appears immediately after (manually) locking textsecure. report.summary: Sending SMS (not allowed!)
report.label: bug
report.description: I configured TextSecure to not use the SMS feature. So no SMS messages should be sent. Since the last update TextSecure sents SMS messages which are not allowed!

report.summary: image sending bug
report.label: bug
report.description: With the lastest TextSecure version, some recipients can't see my sended images. I don't know why, but I forced them to use TS as a replacement for WhatsApp and now they tell me, that they can't see my sended images. Is this a known issue?

report.summary: Enter key does not send
report.label: bug
report.description: Hitting enter simply makes a carriage return and does not send a text. This is despite the "Enter key sends" setting being checked. I'm using version 14.0.9 on Android 5.0.1. Thanks.

report.summary: Contact List: Show all Numbers of one Android Contact
report.label: bug
report.description: If you have one Android contact with 2 mobile phones (= two Independent Text Secure Installations) only one of the cell phone numbers appears in the contact list under "Textsecure users". If you would like to add the second " hidden" number to a group, you cannot do it, because the number is not visible in the list. Android 5 / latest TS Version

report.summary: hidden conversation when all messages deleted before writing new ones
report.label: bug
report.description: enter existing conversation delete all messages right(at least it sounds similar) write a new one exit conversation --> not in conversation list

report.summary: notification unread message when locking textsecure
report.label: bug
report.description: Evertytime I lock TextSecure I get a notification about an unread message from a certain contact (always the same contact), but it is wrong as I already have read all messages.

report.summary: Difficult to select some messages
report.label: bug
report.description: After I upgraded from 2.3.3 to 2.4.0 I have difficulties selecting some messages. Not all messages - it seems to be just those messages where TextSecure recognises a phonenumber in the message text. When I long-press such a message and release my finger from the screen the selection disappears. To select such a message I have to long press, don't release my finger, press another message in the thread so I select 2 messages and then short-press the last one so it leaves the selection. Update: I tested this on 2 devices, one no-name cheap Android 4.2.2 which does not have this problem. A Sony XPeria Z1 Compact with 4.4.4 does have this problem.

report.summary: share / add attachment: picture == > crash
report.label: bug
report.description: same problem still existing! .... was closed on thread #2248 (i didnt know if should open a new one again or post in closed. couldnt find in guidelines) what happened there on the closed thread? i dont see the progress. cheers Device : Samsung GT-I9305 (m3xx) Android: omni_i9305-userdebug 4.4.4 KTU84P 440 test-keys App : TextSecure 2.4.2 when i send a picture from gallery / or as attachment out of TS or from my camera. it crashes. can someone confirm this? log: https://gist.github.com/d0195640abc36b4f8cf5
