report.summary: Wrong default MMS settings for Slovenian provider Tu≈°mobil
report.label: bug
report.description: My sister's phone wasn't able to send/recieve MMS messages so I checked things out. When I entered the manual settings that I copied from the default SMS/MMS app on her phone it worked. I believe that one setting is set wrong and all the others are ok. provider: Tu≈°mobil WRONG: MMS Proxy: 91.185.221.085 OK: MMS Proxy: 91.185.221.85 I wanted to open Pull request and correct the setting myself but wasn't sure which is the right file to edit.

report.summary: Mark/Select picture attachment at conversation - problems.
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi folks, when i try to select an attachment (picture) at the conversation while pressing "ON" the picture, it gets marked but as soon i release my finger from the screen the picture automaticly gets unmarked. After repeating the following steps 5-6 times he finally catched my selection. BUT! When i mark next to the picture, on the blank screen, it gets marked immediately. U need a log for this?

report.summary: new conversation FAB inaccessible
report.label: bug
report.description: Running the latest TextSecure on an LG Optimus F3Q, I am no longer able to focus the button to compose a new message using the keyboard on the phone. I seem to have no trouble focusing any other elements on the screen, I just can't find this button. I was able to focus the button in the previous version, but I can no longer find it with my arrow keys as of today. I was able to find it by exploring the screen with my finger using both Talkback and Spiel screen readers, but in both cases, the button has no label associated with it, and is now presented to me as simply "button." In order to make best use of this app using my screen reader, the button needs to have a content description associated with it that would allow me to know what the button does. If possible, it should also be able to be focused using a hardware keyboard, whether built in or external.

report.summary: Crash when entering notification sound setting
report.label: bug
report.description: Clicking on the setting option to change the notification sound always crashes textsecure. (It isn't possible to enter the menu to change the default notification sound).

report.summary: Notification includes ghost message if TS is not running/unlocked
report.label: bug
report.description: If TS is not running/unlocked, e.g., after restarting the phone, and a new message arrives, the notification days that two messages have been received. But only one actually is. The ghost message appears to be always from the same contact.

report.summary: Cannot paste into empty text field
report.label: bug
report.description: When I'm composing a text, I'm not able to access the copy/paste context menu if the text field is empty. I'll hold down my finger in the text box, and the copy/paste dialog will either not pop up at all, or it will appear briefly, but disappear before it can be used. However, it works just fine if the text field has any text in it. Can anybody reproduce this on their model? My device info: Model: LG G3 (model no: LGLS990) OS: Android 5.0.1 TextSecure version: 2.5.3

report.summary: TextSecure doesn't properly handle contacts with multiple phone numbers
report.label: bug
report.description: Created contact with two phone numbers. First phone number does not have TextSecure capabilities (not a smartphone). Second phone number has text secure and is registered for push messages. TextSecure (option selected to use TextSecure as the default SMS application) correctly creates two threads (one for each of the numbers) and can receive TextSecure messages from the second number. However, when attempting to send messages to the second number , only the "Send unsecure SMS" and "Send secured SMS" options are presented, so TextSecure messages can not be sent to the second number. Moving the second number to a new contact allows TextSecure to present the option to send TextSecure messages. Moving the second number back into one contact again prevents the "Send TextSecure message" option from being displayed.

report.summary: Conversations are not associated with Contact even though Contact exists for that phonenumber
report.label: bug
report.description: On my LG G2 smartphone, TextSecure is having problems associating my contacts to the conversations. Instead of using the contact image and name it will show the standard "happy face" and the phonenumber the conversation is related to, as if I did not have any contact stored for this number. It should be noted that many of the conversations are correctly associated with the correct contact and thus shows both image and name from the contact. It seems to be rather random what contacts are effected by this bug. I have also seen conversations that was previously associated with the correct contact "forget" this ones a new message arrives, and just show the "happy face" and number instead. I have tried updated the contacts and adding the phonenumber to them again (even adding them several times to the same contact). In some rare cases this made the contact show up correctly, but normally it does not fix anything. I have not been able to find a common course for the problem yet. It does not matter if a contact have only one or several phonenumbers. Also note that the standard message app on the phone works as it should, and shows all conversations with the correct contacts.

report.summary: Missing notifications in Priority Mode / Lollipop
report.label: bug
report.description: When I enable "Priority" mode in Lollipop, the phone won't ring/vibrate, as expected. But I wanted to enable the "ring for starred contacts", for messages as well as incoming calls. It works with the AOSP messaging app, but it doesn't work with TS. Is there a way to fix this? Thx! TextSecure 2.5.3 / LG G3 (d855) / CyanogenMod 12 App state: Push registered, incoming SMS enabled (default app), outgoing SMS enabled

report.summary: notifications for group messages
report.label: bug
report.description: when multiple people post new messages in a group chat, the notification on android assigns them all to the first person that posted. Only when I open the app, I learn that they are from multiple people. Maybe it would be more straightforward to show the group name in notifications instead?

report.summary: Adding an invite should not replace a draft message
report.label: bug
report.description: It should be appended to the draft instead, otherwise it's a dataloss.

report.summary: Back Button doesn't bring you back from conversation to conversation list
report.label: bug
report.description: For instance, two messages from one conversation partner arrive in a row and the the phone was in standby in between. Pushing the he back button brings you back to the same conversation instead of the list: message arrives open message from notification standby message arrives open message from notification back button jumps back to same conversation back button goes to overview Is this by design or a bug?

report.summary: Resend button in message details gives no real feedback
report.label: bug
report.description: You can tap the resend button all day long. It just blinks on taping. That's it. You don't know if it's resending or not. At least for my failed MMS.

report.summary: Notification can show incorrect message receipt time
report.label: bug
report.description: If I have a notification for two (or more) messages from different senders, the notification correctly displays the time of the most recent message. However, if I read this second message without reading the first one, the notification time is updated to the time that I read the second message, rather than the receipt time of the first message.

report.summary: Dates are displayed in system locale regardless of language setting
report.label: bug
report.description: Currently all the dates and times are diplayed regarding the android system locale using DateUtils.formatDateTime. Sometimes its even mixed because the plurals hours_ago and minutes_ago are translated. My system language is set to german but I'm using TextSecure in english: It would be more consistent if the dates are formatted regarding the textsecure language setting I guess.

report.summary: Message Details v2.7.0b1
report.label: bug
report.description: There's no scrolling in Message Details. A long SMS does fill the screen, isn't fully displayed, and the details aren't shown. Regards C

report.summary: ClassCastException for MMS notification records
report.label: bug
report.description: v2.7.0-b1 https://gist.github.com/18eb6203060d8d58a07a

report.summary: Empty dialer problem
report.label: bug
report.description: So as you can see here there is a send message button If I type something in the dialer is working as expected if its empty and press it I get here and I cannot add contacts and if I type something the app crashes.So when the dialer is empty this is where the app should open android version 2.3.6 textsecure latest play store 2.6.4

report.summary: Emoji pane losing history
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi! Since version 2.6, TextSecure loses the emoji history (last used emojis) from time to time. Never happened before with older version. Thanks for your great work!

report.summary: SMS don't come in
report.label: bug
report.description: My sms go through but don't come in and the other person is also using textsecure...

report.summary: Video needs to be saved on disc to be playbacked
report.label: bug
report.description: I received a MP4 file from an iOS user (don't know if that has an impact); by trying to playback out of the conversation with vlc i received an error message: can not connect to file, please try to update media db. After saving the file playback was possible on my Nexus 4 running LRX22C version 2.6.4.

report.summary: Messages sent to group delivered to private chat after the sender uses a new PreKey
report.label: bug
report.description: Sender's Device: LG G3 running Lolipop, TextSecure 2.6.4 / 2.7.1 (not sure) Receiver's Device: Nexus 5 running Lolipop, TextSecure 2.7.1 Issue details: An existing TextSecure user switched to a new phone and installed TextSecure on it The user sent a message to an existing group member which accepted his new identity then added him to the group. Other group members did not yet approve his new identity. Whenever the user with a new identity sends a message to the group, users who didn't yet accept his new identity receive a "private chat notification" asking them to confirm his unknown identity or cancel. after confirming each "confirm identity" notification, the message which was supposed to be delivered to the group is delivered to the private chat instead of group chat. no idea about future messages, but i believe they would be delivered normally to the group after confirming the identity.

report.summary: Crash on message receive
report.label: bug
report.description: I was reading a conversation as two messages arrived and TS crashed instantly. One of them was for the conversation I was looking into. Crash log is here: https://gist.github.com/dacb1a8a3ef662a2921f

report.summary: Zero character passphrases?
report.label: bug
report.description: Textsecure 2.7.1 Samsung SGH-T399 Android 4.2.2 When setting up a passphrase, textsecure accepts a passphrase that is zero characters long. From a usability standpoint and to avoid confusion, it seems like we should require passphrases to be at least one character long. What do people think?

report.summary: Selecting failed messages is impossible
report.label: bug
report.description: -send a message and make it fail (somehow) -try to select the message to delete it The only workaround I found is to select another message first, then select the failed one, deselect the first one and then delete the failed one Thank you

report.summary: New identity popup dialog wrong theme
report.label: bug
report.description: Latest HEAD Using dark theme, when tapping in the conversation on the "changend identiy" bubble, the popup dialog uses the white theme. when tapping 'verify' from within the details view the dark themed popup appears. EDIT thinking about it, the detail dialog should not show the verify message, when opening the already verified message. Does not appear after reentering the conversation and opening the message details.

report.summary: Notification sound doesn't work upon installation
report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed after installation that when I receive messages, it didn't make a sound, it only flashed the notification light. I go to Settings -> Notifications, and I can see "Sound = Argon" is displayed. I press on 'Sound', which takes me to the sound selection list, but here there is none selected. I now select Argon from the list, back in settings it says "Sound = Argon" as before, but from now the app is making notification sounds. My colleague also had the same problem.

report.summary: ConversationItem manipulating view in wrong thread
report.label: bug
report.description: If there is ever an error while resolving a conversation item thumbnail then ConversationItem.ThumbnailListener will get a callback to onFailure() which will in turn trigger an uncaught android.view.ViewRoot$CalledFromWrongThreadException exception. https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/ConversationItem.java#L615 call should be moved into handler.post(...)

report.summary: Error "Some issues need your attention" after adding 10th person to a group
report.label: bug
report.description: After adding 10 people to a group, all sent messages are shown as "Not delivered" When tapping on "Tap for details" all it says is "Some issues need your attention." with a list of the users in the group.

report.summary: Group messages prompts to send message multiple times, after connection failed
report.label: bug
report.description: After a connection failure, the resend dialoge prompts you to resend the message for each participant, resulting in multiple messages for all groupmembers. E.g: group of 5 people => TS prompts you to resend the message to 4 persons => group chat gets filled with 4 identical messages. Version: TS 2.9.2

report.summary: Can't share to TextSecure via the share intent
report.label: bug
report.description: As of 0ff9925 ("move routing logic to all activities"), sharing via an intent doesn't work. To reproduce: Share some text to TextSecure (via some other app's "Share" functionality) TextSecure will show the "Share with" menu with some contacts (and a plus button) Tap a contact (or tap the plus button and select one from the list) The contact's thread will open (or if it was a new contact, a new thread will be created), but the shared text won't be prefilled in the text box. Android 4.4.4 (CM11), commit 0ff9925 .

report.summary: MMS download failed!
report.label: bug
report.description: After updating to TextSecure 2.9.3 iPhone group chat messages seem to all be resolving to MMS download failed! Device: LGE LGLS90 Android: 5.0.1

report.summary: Unable to run instrumentation tests due to proguard
report.label: bug
report.description: Running ./gradlew proguardDebugTest now fails (probably an issue with the refactor). The log is huge so I've put it on pastebin: http://pastebin.com/rkQ0BxUZ

report.summary: Bad multi-recipient notification behavior
report.label: bug
report.description: Tapping on a TextSecure notification with multiple senders now opens something that says it's a group chat with 0 members, rather than opening to the ConversationList. I assume this is a regression caused by the RoutingActivity change. I don't know what happens if you try to respond in that group thread, but it can't be good. We should probably try to get a 2.10.1 out asap.

report.summary: The design of 'Possible problems' dialog is broken
report.label: bug
report.description: The dialog in registration problems is broken the same way as in #2853 (except there are no crashes, just a broken design): Apologies for the non-English (and boring) screenshot. I run into this yesterday while setting up another device for testing purposes. The greyed text 'Mahdollisia ongelmia' is the string 'Possible problems' at Transifex (RegistrationProblemsActivity_possible_problems). Android 4.0.4, TS 2.9.3

report.summary: forward message to contact for which you have no existing conversation, broken.
report.label: bug
report.description: open some conversation select some text message in that conversation click "Forward message" select a contact for which you don't have an existing conversation action bar updates as expected but conversation view still shows messages from original thread

report.summary: Alignment of the keyboard / Smiley switch for long texts
report.label: bug
report.description: If you type a long message, the keyboard / Smiley switch gets aligned vertically in the middle, thereby moving upwards the longer your message is. Whatsapp etc. has a fixed position on the bottom, which makes it easier for unskilled users to notice it's position. 2.10.1

report.summary: TextSecure is using an outdated emoji set
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, I am just submitting this issue just in case you will stay with the Google Emoji set, instead of changing the Emoji set as requested over there: WhisperSystems#2892 I assume the Emoji set used for the internal TextSecure Emoji drawer is the Google Emoji set residing over there: https://github.com/WhisperSystems/TextSecure/tree/master/assets The Google Emoji set there is an old version of the Google Emoji set though. The Google Emoji set recently has been updated, for more details see: http://blog.emojipedia.org/android-50-emoji-changelog and: http://blog.emojipedia.org/209-new-emoji-flags-available-today So, in case you should stay with the Google Emoji set, please update it to the latest version. Regards

report.summary: Barcode Scanner's camera view temporarily messes up with translations
report.label: bug
report.description: System language: English (US), TextSecure language: Japanese (or any translated language) Go to a conversation Tap identity verification from the lock icon Choose to scan a code After Barcode Scanner has opened, go back (don't have to scan anything) Note that the title of this view has changed to English (also the overlay text from Barcode Scanner is in English "No scanned key found") Go back to conversation view All the menus are in English and also the text box tl;dr: just watch this .gif: If the system language is set to non-English there is no issue. Also Barcode Scanner's QR code view does not cause this ‚Äì only the camera. Tested with: Android 5.0.1 and 4.0.4; TextSecure 2.10.1 (first time I run into this was in 2.6 or earlier)

report.summary: tests broken by proguard changes
report.label: bug
report.description: can no longer run $ gradlew connectedCheck

report.summary: native system emoji overriding TextSecure-provided ones
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, the Emoji drawer in TextSecure currently is using the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emoji set. A lot of Android phones do not have the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emoji set as their native system Emoji set though. Samsung uses their own Emoji set, LG uses their own Emoji set, HTC uses their own Emoji set and so on... You can see some of those Emoji sets over there: http://emoji.codes/family Unfortunately though, TextSecure does not replace the native system Emojis with the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emojis, when the native system Emojis are not the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emojis, like on Samsung, LG and HTC devices for example. So, when Samsung/LG/HTC users tap on one of the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emojis in the TextSecure Emoji drawer, a Samsung/LG/HTC Emoji appears in the message input box and in the messages themselves, and not the Google "Noto Color Emoji" Emojis the user actually selected. So, could you please replace/overwrite the Emojis in the message input box and in the messages (and everywhere else where it is possible) with the Emojis that are being used in the Emoji drawer? Telegram for Android also has a built-in Emoji drawer and also has built-in Emojis. And Telegram for Android does replace/overwrite the Emojis in the message input box and in the messages (and everywhere else where it is possible) with the Emojis that are being used in the Emoji drawer. So it is possible to do it. Could you please fix this and do it like Telegram for Android is doing it? Regards

report.summary: Visible glitch when toggling between keyboard and built-in Emoji drawer
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, when toggling between the keyboard and the TextSecure Emoji drawer, the TextSecure Emoji drawer appears above the keyboard for a brief momen and "fades" into the keyboard, which looks like a glitch and is uneasy on the eyes. In Telegram for Android, that does not happen. In Telegram for Android, when toggling between the built-in Emoji drawer and the keyboard, the toggle happens instantly, the Emoji drawer instantly replaces the keyboard, without any transition or whatever, which looks much smoother. In TextSecure it currently looks buggy and is quite uneasy on the eyes. Could you please fix it? Regards

report.summary: Long-pressing emoji backspace deletes only one character
report.label: bug
report.description: Another lovely emoji keyboard related issue: If you want to remove ten characters with the emoji drawer's backspace you have to tap it ten times. Long press does not work. Compare to the regular keyboards' backspace which you can tap and hold to remove everything at once. Tested with: TS 2.11.0, Android 5.0.1, Android 4.0.4

report.summary: 'all images' view froze my phone
report.label: bug
report.description: Here is the debug log, I was just scrolling down the list of images: https://gist.github.com/c4b8126902f42fe0eb57

report.summary: Wrong image preview in 'all images' view
report.label: bug
report.description: Hey guys :) I noticed a bug where the image preview in 'all images' is not the right one. (Nexus 4, Android 5.1, TS 2.11.1) How to reproduce: Open a chat with many pictures in it and click on 'all images' (in the chat where I noticed the bug are about 150 pics I guess) Scroll down to the bottom of all the images Click on any image The preview is different than the actual picture you open If I wait a few seconds and click on the preview and go back and scroll a bit and click on it again it's the right one but not on the first/second click... This issue may be related to #840. You can find the log here: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/bbb8be8f2e0fb06821f3

report.summary: "There are four lights!" or How conversation list's 'select all' disregards search results
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to your conversation list Search for some subset of your conversations Tap and hold to select at least one of the conversations from the search results Now tap 'select all' from the top right corner TS will select all of your conversations instead of just all the search results (6. If you want to live dangerously try to delete the selected messages by tapping the trash bin. It will remove all conversations. This proves that it really selects all conversations and not just misrepresent the number of selected messages.) A .gif demonstration (does not strictly follow the above steps): TS 2.11.1, Android 5.0.1 and also 4.0.4

report.summary: [Security Risk] Login Screen and last character of password visible in app switcher
report.label: bug
report.description: The last state of the login screen is visible in the app switcher, making it possible to see the length and the last character of the password. Screen protection is enabled. PW was typed in followed by quickly pressing enter on the keyboard. Is this a problem that you can fix or is it not possible because of "Sense"? HTC One X running Android 4.2.2 with HTC Sense 5.0

report.summary: Some images fail to send every time (OOM)
report.label: bug
report.description: There are some images that I just can't get to send over TextSecure push. No matter whether on WiFi, no matter whether I hit retry or create a new message with the same image, it's always "Failed to send". Here is the log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f74e7b419ecd8f692935 Strangely, other images work fine. Are the images that I want to send to large or something like that? Is there a size limit on images over PUSH? If yes, it would be helpful to say that in the error message and even offer to send a compressed version.

report.summary: NPE: ThumbnailView, tap preview icon when file not found
report.label: bug
report.description: encountered this while running an unmodified debug build of 27a5b7d sequence of events were: send a bunch of text messages send a bunch of media messages do the same while screwing around with airplane mode attach image image preview is an error icon (may have been ic_action_warning_red or ic_missing_thumbnail_picture, can't remember) click on error image preview crash I then tried to reproduce by simply returning to the convo and reattaching the same image, crash again. Did this a few more times and once the image preview was entirely blank (but still took up the space it should), clicked on that too, crash. While in this crashable state I attempted to reproduce this using a different attachment, no crash. Thinking it may have had something to do with cache I tried another different image that definitely should not have been in cache, also no crash. report.description: Built a RC and tried sending a few images. This happens every so often, where the entire message bubble (except for the arrow) fails to render:

report.summary: Sending a deleted image gets stuck in pending state
report.label: bug
report.description: This came up in #3046 briefly. Sometimes when you delete a picture it will leave around ghost thumbnails that are visible in the system gallery and also in TS attachment gallery. This can lead to the following issue if you try to send the deleted image: Delete a picture that's on your device with shell or a file manager (or create a ghost thumbnail in some other way) Attach that picture to a TS message using the attachment gallery's Recent tab (the gallery does not know that the picture was deleted) You will get a missing thumbnail icon Tap send TS will create an "empty" message that gets stuck in a pending state for eternity If you try to do the same in Google Hangouts you will get a 'Can't find picture' notification and you cannot send the image. TextSecure should also check if the file exists and not trust the gallery viewer. .gif demonstration: TS 2.12.0, stock Android 5.1 and Android 4.0.4

report.summary: Group message notification opens private conversation when TS is locked with passphrase
report.label: bug
report.description: Passphrase enabled Get TS locked Ask Cthulhu to send you a group message Tap message notification to open TS Enter your passphrase to unlock TS TS will take you to a private conversation with Cthulhu (and display a new notification again) Go to conversations list and see that the message was indeed a group message .gif demonstration: If TS unlocked everything works as expected. I.e. group message notification takes you to the group conversation. TS 2.12.0 Stock Android 5.1 Android 4.0.4

report.summary: delete thread on new conversation appears to do nothing
report.label: bug
report.description: 2.12.0 from play store. unexpected behavior 00: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists options menu > delete thread > yes nothing happens unexpected behavior 01: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists create a draft but don't leave the conversation options menu > delete thread > yes nothing happens the behavior I expect is to be returned to the conversation list view and not see any sign of the previous new conversation, this goes well if a draft is saved for the conversation like so: click the new conversation button select a contact for which no conversation exists create a draft go back to conversation list view reopen the new conversation options menu > delete thread > yes thread deleted and returned to conversation list view

report.summary: You can still send messages when you are left alone in a group
report.label: bug
report.description: If you leave a group the thread is not deleted but you lose the ability to type in the input box and send messages. [1] I assume this is the expected behavior as you might still want to view past messages after leaving. However if everyone else leaves the group you can still do everything: type text, add attachments and send messages. This makes no sense since there are no recipients anymore. The thread should be "locked" as in the case above where you are the one who leaves. Adding more people (updating group) should "unlock" the conversation again. There are many issues about groups but could not find anything about this case. TS 2.12.0, stock Android 5.1 Edit: Here's a debug log after the following steps: Open TS first time after boot Go to a group All the other people leave the group (in this debug log all the other people = one person) I send a message to the empty group ([1] You can still type using the TS emoji drawer. Also you can add attachments. But it might be best to add this as a separate issue.)

report.summary: NewConversationActivity contact filter behaves differently on different phones
report.label: bug
report.description: method source given the above fuzzy filter "%" + filter + "%" you would expect that for the string Axolotl the following filters would match: [Axo, olo, otl]. however, on certain phones only the first (Axo) matches. incomplete list of affected devices confirmed via TestObject: EDIT: I think the root of this problem is actually in ContactsDatabase.queryAndroidDb(), not ContactsDatabase.queryLocalDb(). Give the string Axolotl and the filters [Axo, olo, otl], the following devices will only match on (Axo) when expected to match on all 3. Motorola DROID X2, Samsung I9070, HTC One SV, Fairphone, Wiko Rainbow, HTC One S.

report.summary: Date format does not respect locale
report.label: bug
report.description: Currently TS seems to display all dates in the format MMM d, yyyy irrespective of the locale. The dates are translated correctly though. Here's some information about date formats in various regions: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Date_format_by_country TS 2.13.0 This issue does not depend on whether you have changed the system language or TS language. Neither work.

report.summary: Update the default led notification color to match the current UI
report.label: bug
report.description: This is such a minor issue that it feels almost a sin reporting this but sometimes details are important. Currently the default led notification color is green. However the only green left in TextSecure are the message bubbles when using unencrypted SMS. Otherwise TextSecure is all about blue now (icon, UI, push messages). Therefore the default led color should follow suit.

report.summary: message notification contact photo solid white for contact with no picture
report.label: bug
report.description: built from 4ad9d6b running on my Nexus 5, Lollipop 5.1 in the conversation list view contact "lol myself" has no associated image, so an avatar is generated, the output is pink and the letter "l". however when I receive a message form "lol myself" the generated avatar is not shown in the message notification, in its place is only white.

report.summary: Cursor not shown when typing a message
report.label: bug
report.description: You know the little pulsing bar that appears when writing something in a text box? (I'm sure i thas a name but I can't think of a better description right now). Since 2.14.1 (probably 2.14) it has disappeared from textsecure. This obviously makes it hard and uncomfortable to write messages.. I like textsecure, and I appreciate the effort you're putting into it, really. But do you even test the app before releasing updates? Missing commas that screw the phones and make us lose messages, huge usability problems that would've taken 10 seconds to notice... I mean... of course it's human to forget a comma or introduce bugs, we all know it. The problem is that testing should be considered fundamental, even when you have beta testers. Beta testers are supposed to find smaller problems, not sacrifice their product for the sake of bugs. That's what the developers should be doing. Apologies if it sounds rude, and thanks again.

report.summary: NewConversationActivity only shows contacts if TS is default app (on Galaxy S4)
report.label: bug
report.description: the contact list in NewConversationActivity will be empty unless TextSecure is set to be the default SMS app on Samsung Galaxy S4 devices-- or at least the one I tested. we've run into a couple issues with the contact query used in this activity such as #2378 and another mentioned by @mcginty where sometimes the query takes upwards of 5 seconds to complete. we should look into some alternatives.

report.summary: Some avatars not rendered in contact list
report.label: bug
report.description: Go to main conversation list Tap the pen icon on the lower right to get to the contact list Tap your device's Back button to hide the keyboard that just popped up Some contact avatars do not get rendered at all This affects both picture contacts and initial creation contacts. Scrolling usually fixes the issue or moves it to another contact. It seems that if you dismiss the keyboard (step 3) quickly it increases the likelihood of missing avatars. TS 2.14.5 Nexus 4, stock Android 5.1 Huawei U8800, Android 4.0.4 Debug log: https://gist.github.com/74ba14ab06491edd4749 (On the second try 4 avatars not rendered)

report.summary: TS emojis not used in notifications
report.label: bug
report.description: Some TextSecure emojis are not used in Android notifications. Here's an example message that I received from a strange number. The message contains the AIRPLANE (U+2708) emoji which is displayed differently in notifications and in TS: Lock screen notification: Notification drawer: Heads-up notification: And finally the actual TextSecure message: The meaning of the message changes completely depending on the emoji set used. Now I don't know if I should report this unknown sender to the authorities (like the good, law-abiding citizen I am) or just wish this person a safe trip. I'm not certain if the emojis in the notifications can even be changed but I'm under the impression that WhatsApp does show it's own iOS-like emojis in Android notifications. Related #2936 TS 2.16.2 Nexus 4, stock 5.1.1

report.summary: units
report.label: bug
report.description: On the textSecure panel showing the list of threads, each of them has a field showing the time elapsed since the last message. typically I read something like "11 mins". I wonder what the s after min stands for. Unit for minute is min, and units do not take plural form. Unfortunately I must say that this trend of putting plural mark to units is more and more common in the US, and it appears that it is getting more common in other countries as well. Spreading that nonsense is definitely not good so I suggest that the "plural unit issue" be taken care of as soon as possible. Check also for the hour, I am pretty sure that soon some "hrs" will show up. "h" would actually be the best, while "hr" being also accepted. Thank you

report.summary: Height of Emoji drawer does not match height of system keyboard
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, using TextSecure 2.16.3 on an LG G2 running latest stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop), the height of the Emoji drawer does not match the height of the system keyboard. The Emoji drawer is higher than the system keyboard (tested with Google Keyboard from Play Store). Could you please fix that and make the height of the Emoji drawer equal to the height of the system keyboard? Regards

report.summary: Message disappears on send when sharing photo
report.label: bug
report.description: I first noticed this after the recent update to the Photos app. When sharing from within that app, a toast notification says "Sharing to TextSecure..." and the message composition process continues as expected. When sent, the message disappears. This bug does not happen when the sharing process is started from within TextSecure through either the paperclip icon or the "Add attachment" menu option. Nexus 5, Android 5.1.1 (LMY48B), T-Mobile US

report.summary: Picture message failure
report.label: bug
report.description: I am running into a problem trying to send a picture on my 1st Gen Moto X running 4.4.4. I'm using TextSecure 2.16.4 in data mode. I took a photo in potrait mode using both the camera app and the in-app option to take a photo. Both times the message will appear in the text window but fail to send. Here's a log from immediately after the failure https://gist.github.com/anonymous/52824d6ed48b2be2a32f I verified that I could send a different photo (in landscape mode) and captured another debug log here https://gist.github.com/anonymous/7f056f9973425195b26c I have tried closing and reopening TextSecure without success. It seems specific to this photo as other photos (both taken on the phone or from other sources) are able to be sent. I'm not sure if it's the subject (as other issues mentioned grass being hard to compress) or the orientation of the photo. This seems similar to #3070 or #3028. Also seems like this might have just recently been fixed in version 2.17. Sorry if this is a duplicate. Picture here

report.summary: tile person images to denote group mms chats
report.label: bug
report.description: When viewing the conversation list, all mms group conversation icons only display for THE FIRST PERSON listed in the group chat. If a image is available, it will display only one contact image, otherwise if an contact image is not available, the the first letter of the first contact's first name is shown. I would like to see group chat icons in the conversation list denoted with a tile view comprised of the group contacts (possibly up to 4 tiles). It seems the special TextSecure groups have a stock grey icon to denote those type of chats since they have a group title/name. For example, if there are 3 contacts in the group MMS (2 friends plus yourself) the visual icon on the conversation list would show a vertically split tile view of your contacts photo or the Letter of their first name if a photo is not available. For reference, is similar to the Google hangout view. [][] [][] [ __ ] [][] [][] Consider similar feature for the special TextSecure group icon. version 2.16.4

report.summary: Handle early-arriving delivery receipts
report.label: bug
report.description: In a multi-device world, it's quite common for one device to receive a delivery receipt for a message sent from another paired device before the message content itself is synced between them. In this case, the android client never marks that message as delivered.

report.summary: Wrong ringtone when TS is locked
report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed that when TS is locked all the notifications use the same ringtone. Is this intentional? It's making me miss some messages. I'm running Android 4.1.2 and TS 2.20

report.summary: TS Media Messages Received Timestamps Report Different Times
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes I receive an MMS (over push) when I am offline; when I finally come back online, I get the MMS message with two different received timestamps. My guess is that one timestamp corresponds to the time sent, and the other time stamp corresponds to the time received. This seems to be confusing and unnecessary information for the user, who probably only cares about when the message is sent, and doesn't understand why the time stamps are different. Device info: Sony Xperia Z3 Tablet Compact, stock android 4.4.4, TextSecure 2.21.0? (I compiled from b7492eb) App state: Push registered, incoming SMS disabled, outgoing SMS fully disabled Debug logs: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/98fe3fb59609cd429909 Example here where the last picture received has a timestamp difference of about 4 minutes, because that's how long I was offline. Both of these screenshots were taken within a minute of each other.

report.summary: bad encrypted message

report.description: this debug log is from the phone of a friend (Friend), situation: Friend has ongoing conversation with Person Person has TextSecure installed, conversation is secure Friend has no cell reception for 1 week Friend regains cell reception Friend receives a bunch of messages, one being from Person Person's message reads "Bad encrypted message" and below it another messages reads "Secure session ended" debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c93f461080d609d777cc

report.summary: Dark theme groups use light theme's color

report.summary: Group conversation bugs.
report.label: bug
report.description: There are some bugs in group conversations when following these steps. Two parties, ÔºÉ1 and ÔºÉ2 ÔºÉ1 disables Textsecure-messages in settings ÔºÉ2 creates a group conversation and invites ÔºÉ1 ÔºÉ1 enables Textsecure-messages in settings ÔºÉ2 sends a message in the group conversation This scenario resulted in four found bugs The first message that is sent by ÔºÉ2 in step 4 is not received by ÔºÉ1. When a message is successfully transmitted, the group thread appears in ÔºÉ1 chat list. But it doesn't have the selected thread name. It uses Unnamed group. Pressing the "show members" icon will not display any members. (Major problem) ÔºÉ1 can't open the keyboard. Pressing the emoji icon will open the emoji drawer but it is not possible to press send. Attaching a file is also possible, but it is not possible to press end. Device info: Samsung Galaxy S5. Android 5.0. Textsecure 2.26.2. Sony Z3 Compact. Android 5.1.1. Textsecure 2.25.3. App state: Push registered. Enable/Disable Textsecure-messages. Log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/f47acfb7b705db94e712 Related issues: WhisperSystems/TextSecure-Browser#274 I am investigating what causes this problem. Would appreciate any comments/advice, specially on the 4th bug.

Only the first time everything worked fine; however, thereafter everytime, after having successfully established a connection, my phone would not transmit anything I said nor would I hear anything my friend said. It's as if my phone was dead, even though the app indicates are normally functioning call. I adjusted my phone's volume during such calls, it doesn't seem like the volume had been set to zero or something. A couple of times the connection would sort of disappear with both phones stating in the top bar that a phone call to an unknown recipient was active (clicking on that notification gave a screen identical to the one depicted in WhisperSystems#4234.) In the most recent attemts to call my friend her phone wouldn't even ring anymore In case someone found the time to have a look, here are the logs. My phone (Signal 3.0.3, Android 4.2.2): https://gist.github.com/4ed595aa929def90900a and (most recently with the failed call initialization) https://gist.github.com/a2ac6019b5f7ec93c826 Other phone (Signal 3.0.3, Android 4.1.2): https://gist.github.com/7bc9ccc7422fa9709896

report.summary: switching between secure and insecure persists between contacts
report.label: bug
report.description: I have a few contacts that still have Signal installed in hopes of bugs like WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS#421 being resolved but do not prefer Signal for their daily driver until the application is usuable for them. Which for users that are experiencing this iOS bug, the application is insanely frustrating to use. Signal rightfully defaults to messaging being secure. However, when I switch to insecure for this contact, move to another contact the method of delivery is still insecure. This is also true the other way around. If I switch that contact back to secure and then go to the contact that prefers insecure (iMessage conveniences etc.) then the delivery is set to secure. Steps to reproduce: Open Signal contact "A", send insecure message Open Signal contact "B", message defaults to insecure Change delivery of message for Signal contact "B" back to secure. Switch to Signal contact "A", message delivery now set to secure due to action in step 3 I would like to see a per-conversation or per-contact preference for delivery of secure vs insecure. An additional "remind/confirm insecure messages in x days/hours" would also be awesome.

report.summary: unable to receive messages if swiped off from Recents
report.label: bug
report.description: Updated (2016-02-27): Version: 3.12 Nexus is ok. x5pro still misbehaving. The bug is likely in the rom. But since there are so many affected devices and related regressions as system and apps are updated, I'll keep this issue open unless told otherwise. 2016-02-23: Version: 3.11.1 Affected devices: Nexus 4 and Doogee X5 Pro. Stock unrooted roms or rooted roms regardless. Possibly dupe of: #1037 This used to only affect the x5pro but now the nexus recently shown the same bug. Also, Whatsapp doesn't display this bug so this is likely a Signal issue \ workaround-able android issue. Previously: Notes: Version: 3.8.1 This is was originally thought to be an OEM related bug. Now it's been confirmed on two separate devices from two separate OEMs. One of which is running a custom ROM... Also, I have no idea how process and memory management actually works in Dalvik\ART so the terminology section is my ad-hoc attempt to work around this. Terminology: Foregrounded: Visible. Full-screened. "The running" app. Backgrounded: Closed. Still visible in the Recents tasks list. Shown to be running under in Settings->Apps->Running Apps. Daemonized: Closed, Not visible in Recents. But still shown running as a service in Settings->Apps->Running Apps. Killed: Closed, Not visible in Recents. Not shown under Settings->Apps->Running Apps. Scenario: 2 clients; 1 Nexus 4 (works as expected), 1 Doogee X5Pro (misbehaving). Working: 1. When both phones have Signal foregrounded, messages pass back and forth smoothly and instantaneously. 2. When Signal is Foregrounded on one phone while backgrounded on the other, a notification appears correctly. 3. When the Nexus has Signal daemonized after being swiped off Recents, while the X5pro is sending through a foregrounded Signal, a notification appears correctly. 4. When the X5pro has Signal backgrounded, notifications appear correctly while the Nexus is sending them through the foregrounded Signal client. Not-working: Swiping off Signal from Recents doesn't daemonize the process. Instead it's killed and Signal messages fail to transfer. SMSs still work (I'm guessing a separate android daemon\service handles that). Extra-credits: When remaining opened under Recents, Signal is indicated to occupy 26mb. When daemonized it's 6mb. Since I have no idea how Dalvik\Android actually manages memory, I can't say if that's address space (virtual memory) or resident memory or just what the Dalvik's process heap is pointing at... TLDR: Seems on some phones, swiping off Signal from the Recents tasks-list doesn't daemonize properly. Instead, Signal is closed off entirely and Signal messages fail to transfer. Edit: Updated reflecting further feedback. And version.

report.summary: Signal crashes when notification sound is set to "none" and in-conversation notifications are enabled.
report.label: bug
report.description: Android 5.1 Signal 3.9.1 (also observed on previous versions - can't be more specific). https://gist.github.com/anonymous/291abefd9fa914074d60 If notification sound is set to "None" and "In-conversation notifications" are turned on Signal will crash whenever you receive a message while having the conversation open. This only occurs when the conversation the message is a part of is currently open. It doesn't occur if a different conversation is open or if Signal is in the background. When you re-open the app the message that caused the crash will display properly. This affects both Signal conversations and regular SMS conversations with Signal as the SMS client.

report.summary: Names with accents (diacritics) wrong sorted in contact list
report.label: bug
report.description: Contact list displays names with accents in the wrong order resulting in people named "√Ålvaro" being sorted after "Zacar√≠as" (not able to attach image at the moment). I think COLLATE LOCALIZED in https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/src/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/contacts/ContactsDatabase.java (line 150) will do the trick but i'm not a programmer. According to what I've found: [LOCALIZED] It instructs SQLite to sort non-ASCII characters appropriately. Chars with diacritics (some call them accents) have higher byte codes than the character Z, so a plain ASCII sort wouldn't fit to many foreign languages. For example, the capital A char's byte code is 0x41 and the capital Z char's is 0x5A. Then we have the √Å (capital A accute) which code in Unicode is 0x00C1. So a plain byte code sort would result the √Å to be after the Z. But in languages that have this kind of characters the convention is to put those with diacritics as if they didn't have the diacritic. So the √Å should be together with the plain A, at least before B. And to illustrate, we have below a list of names sorted using their bytecode: Brenda Debby George √Ålvaro √ârico Now using the COLLATE LOCALIZED it would sort by the "base" of the character: √Ålvaro Brenda Debby √ârico George" Thank you very much for your great work.

report.summary: Selecting multiple attachments to send crashes the app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description If I want to send someone more than one image at once (I know that's not implemented (#4629), but selecting them is possible with e.g. Amaze File Manager or any other file managing app I guess), Signal crashes. As far as I investigated there is no difference between a Signal contact and an SMS contact. Tested it with images and audio files. Steps to reproduce Press the attachment button and select image Choose your favorite file managing app for the action (I used Amaze File Manager) Select multiple images and click select Crash Device info Model: Fairphone 1U Android version: 4.2.2 Signal version: 3.11.1 Edit: Added debug log: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/e886d1a7dbececee762e

report.summary: Faroese phone numbers
report.label: bug
report.description: Phone numbers from the Faroe Islands have length of 6 digits. The land-code is +298. If I enter my number into the app, f.x +298 123456, the app will return the connectivityFailureLayout. However, if I type my number with a zero at the end (+298 1234560) it will work. This is not pratical, as all my contacts will not be able to contact me encrypted, because I always will reply with my normal number, and not the one with a zero at the end. I'm searching around in the source code, and when debugging the application, I find that the problem is maybe not in the app itself, but in the online service. Here's one log from the app: Opening URL: https://textsecure-service.whispersystems.org/v1/accounts/sms/code/+298123456 And then the app receives a warning: org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.push.exceptions.NonSuccessfulResponseCodeException: Bad response: 400 Bad Request And if add a zero to the end, the 400 Bad Request error goes away. I suspect you have a minimum requirement for at least 7 digits to be typed, but could you edit that to 6?

report.summary: Writing at least 1 letter and then going back makes the message line "jump" down/up
report.label: bug
report.description: Open a chat Write "A" Remove "A" The background "Send Signal..." message will go down in the message bar. Trust me, you will see what I mean. Easily reproducable on Moto G (2015)

report.summary: Hardcoded string in compose subhint for SIM card
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description While looking into #5294, I noticed that the subhint in ComposeText.java has a hardcoded string: setHint(transport.getComposeHint(), transport.getSimName().isPresent() ? "From " + transport.getSimName().get() : null); This should be extracted to a string resource for localization. Signal version: latest master, 24d103d, 3.13.0

report.summary: Secondary phone numbers of Signal users not shown in contact list
report.label: bug
report.description: Additional phone numbers of Signal users are not shown in the contact list. For non Signal users all phone numbers of the contact are available as expected. üëç 1

report.summary: TextSecureAttachment.java Exception "No length specified!"
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates: maybe related to #3882 (closed / unresolved) read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports checked if maybe cyanogenmod 13.0 issue Bug description Every time after I start signal (after successfully entering my password) it loads my messages and immediately crashes. My android signal is linked to a signal chromium app (Chromium: 49.0.2623.87-1, Signal Private Messenger: 0.1.6) . Only android signal seems affected. Steps to reproduce Hard to tell. Occurred only once (5 minutes ago): send images in group chats via android signal wait until it crashes for the first time signal will now crash everytime after starting (after password input) with the following exception: 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: JobConsumer-1 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 3542 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: Theme: themes:{} 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No length specified! 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.whispersystems.textsecure.api.messages.TextSecureAttachment$Builder.build(TextSecureAttachment.java:80) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushSendJob.getAttachmentsFor(PushSendJob.java:78) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushGroupSendJob.deliver(PushGroupSendJob.java:132) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.PushGroupSendJob.onSend(PushGroupSendJob.java:82) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.SendJob.onRun(SendJob.java:43) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.MasterSecretJob.onRun(MasterSecretJob.java:18) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.runJob(JobConsumer.java:76) 03-12 19:19:56.633 3542 3558 E AndroidRuntime: at org.whispersystems.jobqueue.JobConsumer.run(JobConsumer.java:46) Workaround: activate airplane mode search for image in group chat that is still loading/sending delete this image deactivate airplane mode from now everything is fine Screenshots none Device info Model: motorola Moto E (cm_condor) Android version: : 6.0.1 (11d82ef7a5, cm_condor-userdebug 6.0.1 MMB29V 11d82ef7a5 test-keys) Signal version: : Signal 3.13.1 Link to debug log Android signal: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/88d3e5094ceb2db300da#file-cat-log-L27 Chromium app: https://gist.github.com/cholin/79f91c6c77452257fd5e Suggestions Maybe catch exception and just don't try to render failed attachment messages?

Steps to reproduce Contact preferences Verify identity Actual result: Hex identity key bytes are displayed as "(byte)0xaa" Expected result: Hex identity key bytes should be displayed in the format "aa" Screenshots None Device info Device: Google Nexus 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.15.0 Link to debug log None üëç 1

report.summary: buggy comparison in apkdiff
report.label: bug
report.description: hw42@ipsumj.de found that https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/blob/master/apkdiff/apkdiff.py#L64 should be 'or' not 'and'. with 'and' an empty file is equal to everything. (hw42 doesnt have a github account, so I commited this on his behalf.)

report.summary: Back button occasionally not working in conversation
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Sometimes in a conversation I attempt to use the back button to go to the list of conversations and it lights up but doesn't move me back. If I then hit the recents button and choose to go back to Signal the back button responds properly. Steps to reproduce be texting someone and in a conversation screen try to use the back button to go back to your list of conversations Actual result: Sometimes the button lights up indicating it was pressed but doesn't return to the list. Expected result: I would expect to return to my conversation list. Screenshots Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy Note 5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.15.2 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/df54a7f701d2d868e249ef9b609c09fb

report.summary: Group Images are still not getting resized.
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Sending a large Image (f.i. 13MPixel, ~6MB .jpg) to a Group doesn't resize the Image to a lower dimension and filesize. When you send the same Image to a single Contact in contrary, it -does- resize the image. This leads to a large amount of traffic use on both ends. Group images should ideally be handled the same way as single contact images. In a perfect version, the user should be asked for whether it should resize the image or not. This issue has actually been found and fixed 1 year ago here BUT it is still happening in the latest Version of Signal: #2913 Steps to reproduce create a group, add one or more contacts. send a large image (13 MPixel / ~ 6 MB) to this group. Actual result: The Image is not getting resized and Signal sends a whole 6 MB image to the group. The group receives (and has to download) a full 6 MB Image. Expected result: You actually send a resized image (1280 * xxxx, ~200 KB) to that group. The group receives and downloads just a 200 KB Image. Device info Device: LG G3 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.15.2 üëç 1

report.summary: Expiration banner hidden under another banner
report.label: bug
report.description: After the app expires, there is no message to the user that it expired. Only messages simply fail to be send. The only way to discover that the app expired is to see in the debug console: org.thoughtcrime.securesms.TextSecureExpiredException: TextSecure expired (build 1455264177834, now 1463091540114) I think this should be more user friendly. Moreover, it would be great if this could be display also few days at least before the expiration. So that user can react in time. üëç 1

report.summary: Message shown in status bar with enabled option "Display in notifications: Name only"
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The option "Name only" in the notification settings under "Display in notifications" is enabled. If you only receive messages from one person this works as intended. But if you have an unread message from one person and receive a new message from another person, the text of the second message is shown in the status bar of the phone. Steps to reproduce Change the notification settings under Notifications > Display in notifications to Name only Receive message from one person (do not read the message!) Receive message from another person Actual result: The message from the second person should appear as "New message" in the status bar of the phone Expected result: The actual message appears Device info Device: Fairphone 1U Android version: 4.2.2 Signal version: 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b314d9bf5fb0184386839b471e801f1e

report.summary: Duplicate messages being received during standard TextSecure messaging (non group).
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description In standard two device messaging (signal messages, not SMS), one user receives some messages twice, however the sender doesn't see the duplicate message in their history. The log shows that around the same time, the MessageRetrievalService logs a time-out, causing it to loop around for another go. In reality both attempts seem to result in a message being rendered. Steps to reproduce Use two devices (Nexus 5 and Nexus 5x) Proceed to have a secured (TextSecure) conversation Actual result: Nexus 5 receives some messages twice. Expected result: Nexus 5 should receive exactly one message for each message the Nexus 5x sends to it. Screenshots Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5 (hammerhead) Android version: 6.0.1 (2960889, MOB30P) Signal version: Signal 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/177442603d179b543fc9ef6ac7c58ba3#file-cat-log-L229

report.summary: Signal freezes on Android 7 Preview 5 when trying to add an attachment
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal was working without problems on latest Android 6.0.1 on my Nexus 6. Today I've "dirty" flashed the latest Android 7.0 Preview 5 image. I have wiped the cache partition afterwards. Signal is working on Android 7 Preview 5, but when I click the paperclip button to add an attachment, Signal freezes immediately. The blinking cursor in the text input field stops blinking and the app does not respond to any further input. After closing the app by swiping it off the recent apps list, Signal can be opened again. The same happens if I select the respective menu item instead of clicking the paperclip button. Steps to reproduce Open Signal app. Enter a conversation. Click on paperclip button or select respective menu item to add an attachment to the message. Actual result: Signal hangs/freezes immediately. The cursor stops blinking and the app does not respond to any further input. Expected result: The "attachment selection dialogue" is shown, so I can select an attachment to be added to the message. Device info Device: Motorola Nexus 6 Android version: 7.0 Preview 5 (NPD90G) Signal version: 3.16.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/a8c508d1b94d8be848149cd9025fccda üëç 1

report.summary: InviteReminder from an SMS intent for a phone number displays the contact name from the previous InviteReminder
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description InviteReminder from an SMS intent for a phone number displays the contact name from the previous InviteReminder Steps to reproduce Open Android Dialer, choose call history tab. Click on a recent phone call you've had with a contact that has a name, (let's say "ContactName"), but that you have not used signal with, and select "Send a message" Signal opens and displays the invite reminder: "Take your conversation with ContactName to the next level." (from InviteReminder.java) Open Android Dialer, choose call history tab. Click on a recent phone call you've had with that has just a phone number listed with no contact name (let's say "PhoneNumber"), but that you have not used signal with, and select "Send a message" Signal opens and displays the invite reminder: "Take your conversation with ContactName to the next level." (from InviteReminder.java) Actual result: The InviteReminder displays the ContactName from the previous conversation. Expected result: The previous ContactName is not in the InivteReminder. It looks like the InviteReminder is generally not displayed for SMS conversations with phone numbers (no contact name), so perhaps do not display the InviteReminder in this situation. Screenshots Device info Device: Nexus 5X Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 3.17.0 Link to debug log Not included, but please let me know if you need one. üëç 1

report.summary: Bug in new selection of notification messages (save button visible)
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, build 3.18.0 has introduced the ability to select (and delete) notification messages. For group update messages there is a bug. If you select one the save button becomes visible. (Further on it can be clicked. The same procedure like for media messages will be initiated. However I don't know if really something is saved.) Solution: Hide save button for all kinds of notification messages. Please note that only the notification messages of self initiated group updates are affected by this bug. Notification messages of group updates from other group members are not affected. Found in build 3.18.1. üëç 1

report.summary: Crashes when interacting in app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal crashes upon interacting with threads or trying to start new conversation. I also cannot view contacts who are not using Signal. The crash will give the "Unfortunately, Signal has stopped," message and exit signal entirely or revert to the main screen with all threads. Had the same issue during beta testing last week. Logged the problem and then uninstalled the beta version. Cleared cache, uninstalled, reinstalled, same problems. Turned on airplane mode, deleted threads, same problem. Messages are being retrieved and presented as notifications through Signal. Changed to phone's messenger as default SMS app in the meantime. Steps to reproduce Open app Touch a conversation or Begin new conversation Select a contact or Click reply on notification Actual result: Immediately, the error message "Unfortunately, Signal has stopped." appears and exits to the home screen of my phone. Expected result: Ability to look at the thread and type and send messages. Device info Device: HTC One M7 Android version: 5.0.2 Signal version: 3.18.2 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/98d1c821855df39a648ab4b7e107af93 https://gist.github.com/097fe9ba87240354e5108db0dcac35fe üëç 1

report.summary: SMS only, non-Signal Android contact showing up on Signal Desktop after changing its color
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Not sure if this problem is on Signal Android's end or on Signal Desktop's. One of my SMS (non-Signal) contacts just got synched with Signal Desktop after changing its color on Signal Android, i. e. the contact is (was) listed on Signal Desktop's contact list - not the conversation. After exiting Signal Desktop and starting it again, that contact magically disappeared again. Edit: I've been able to reproduce this a second time and updated this issue with new debug logs for Signal Android and Signal Desktop. All logs are now taken directly after the issue happened. Potentially related issue: WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop#903 Steps to reproduce Change color of a non-Signal contact Start Signal Desktop Actual result: Contact shows up on Signal Desktop Expected result: Contact shouldn't show up on Signal Desktop Device info Device: Google Nexus 5 Android version: 6.01 Signal version: 3.19.1 Debug logs: Signal Android directly after changing contact color Signal Desktop directly after contact appeared and is still present Signal Desktop after contact disappeared again

report.summary: Image draft not shown on successive forward
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The image that should be forwarded is not shown above the compose panel. Steps to reproduce You need two conversations, and one both of them need s to contain a picture message. This one is conversation B. Open conversation A Long-press a picture message select "Forward message" from the context menu select conversation B Long-press a media message (optional: with text) select "Forward message" from the context menu select conversation A critical step notice that no picture is shown above the compose panel optional: The forwarded text is shown in the compose panel. If you press the send button at this point, the message will actually be sent including the previously invisible picture. press the back button to leave conversation A look at conversation list entry of conversation A and notice that a draft picture was saved reenter conversation A and notice that the picture is now shown above the compose panel Actual result: The picture from conversation B is not shown after forwarding it to conversation A. Expected result: The picture from conversation B should be shown above the compose panel of conversation A. Device info Device: Fairphone 2 Android version: 5.1.1 Signal version: 3.21.3 Device info Device: Sony Xperia U Android version: 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod) Signal version: 3.21.3

report.summary: Server issue: refuses New-Caledonia numbers
report.label: bug
report.description: It is impossible to set it up in New Caledonia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_New_Caledonia). The app shows an error "Connectivity issue". I had a look to the logcat, and the app sends a request to the server with this url: https://textsecure-service.whispersystems.org/v1/accounts/sms/code/+687xxxxxx If I access it in a browser I get this reply from your server: {"code":400,"message":"HTTP 400 Bad Request"} Then I tried a phone number from France and accessed the url https://textsecure-service.whispersystems.org/v1/accounts/sms/code/+33xxxxxxxxx And it works (well I get an empty response instead of a "400 Bad Request"). There definitely is a server issue not accepting New-Caledonia 6 digits numbers.

report.summary: incorrect labling of button
report.label: bug
report.description: Dear Devs, First kindly accept my kind gratitude for including the voice note feature in Signal Private Messanger for Android. Here, I am reporting a minor issue which can easily be fixed. The Record button or mic button is improperly labled. In the left of the bottom part of the window, there is the 'emoji' button. then, there is the edit box followed by the 'toggle attachment' button. After that, there is the record button I think. but our screen reader (Talkback) announces it as "toggle attachment" button. That's why, we visually challenged persons are getting two 'toggle attachment' buttons, which is a bit confusing. Kind regards, Pradip üëç 2

report.summary: Deleted group reappears when contact safety number changes
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A deleted group shows up again when a group member's security number changes, so without exchanging messages in that group. The group then appears to be in an inactive state, i.e. sending messages is not possible. Steps to reproduce Create a group, group members A and B Delete group on device A (you can even leave the group first) Re-install Signal on device B (safety number changes) Send a message from A to B Confirm safety number change notification on device A Actual result: All deleted groups that contain B reappear on device A. The only content is a safety number change notification, see 848a256. Sending messages is not possible. Expected result: The groups should not reappear. I was surprised to see that group information where still available at all. Device info Android version: stock Android 5.1.1 Signal version: 3.24.1 üëç 2

report.summary: Inconsistency: When watching a video and pressing the gallery button, the video is not in the list of "all pictures"
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Thanks for adding support to play videos in-app. When playing videos of a conversation in-app, the button to go to the gallery ("all pictures") is visible. After pressing the button one can see all the pictures of the conversation. The video, from where I was directed to the gallery, is not visible, though. Steps to reproduce go to a conversation open a video press the gallery button ("all pictures") Actual result: I see all pictures of the conversation. Expected result: Two possibilities: I can see the video in the gallery view as well, since the video is where I come from. (Renaming of the string "all pictures" to "all pictures and videos" or similar) There's no gallery button when watching the video. Device info Signal version: 3.24.1

report.summary: Crash loop on attempting to send image
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description A friend tried to send me a just then taken photo. On preparing the image for sending, signal enters a crash loop. The application becomes unsuable. The crash loop can be broken by disabling wifi and mobile internet and deleting the faulty multimedia message. Symptoms are similar to Bug #5310, the difference being that on my friends phone the error log shows an OutOfMemoryError which does not appear there. Btw: larger images sent without problems. Even though the image displays fine everywhere else, it might be faulty. Steps to reproduce Download 20161210_133710.jpg from dropbox link below to phone Check sha256 hashsum to verify it is indeed the same image that crashes Singnal on my friends Samsung Enable Wifi / Mobile Internet Send Image to another contact using Signal Actual result: Signal crashes repeatedly every few seconds when not in use or when entering the application and becomes unusable. Expected result: Signal should catch all image-processing errors and not crash. Steps to recover from error Disable Wifi / Mobile Internet Enter Signal, delete faulty Image / Message to stop Singal from crashing Image that crashes signal + Versioninfo https://www.dropbox.com/sh/ou6tintrxzw6okd/AABYd3GrkjnkS1SH0dgGl3oZa?dl=0 Device info Device: samsung SM-G900F (kltexx) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.24.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4257a85bab5f738c8496329c80d5d655

report.summary: Image "stickers and scribbles" OOM error, preventable?
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I was testing "Support for stickers and scribbles" (1b44bdc) on a phone that has (only) 768MB of RAM. The picture to be edited was a 3000 * 4000 pixel (w * h) ~1.9MB jpg. Tapping confirm after minimal editing resulted in a OOM error. I got back to the conversation screen and conversation list by tapping the Android back button. Entering the conversation again from the conversation list then let me sent unsecured SMS only, which is a bad experience. Fortunately "force stop" Signal solves the issue. I wonder if the process would succeed if pictures were scaled before editing? Sending the same picture without prior editing works as expected. report.summary: Displays "failed to send" on SMS message that was sent

However, I got a reply from the person I sent it to, indicating that the message was probably sent. This doesn't seem to happen every time I send a message. Steps to reproduce send SMS message Actual result: After several minutes, the app displays a "Failed to send" error message Expected result: Message successfully sends and displays a checkmark Screenshots Forgot to take a screenshot after the bug occurred, and it's not happening anymore for some reason. report.summary: identical message displayed multiple times
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When sending a Signal message (not SMS) from a heavily overloaded (WIFI) network the client attempts to send the message multiple times (expected) and eventually displays a red "!" ("Not delivered. Tap for details"). Apparently the message went through nonetheless and not just once but multiple times and is displayed at all recipients multiple times (group chat). We observed this problem within multiple group chats and was triggered by distinct senders. (I personally observed it in two distinct group chats, friends also confirmed this in other group chats.) Note: the sender did not press any of the "RESEND" buttons. Steps to reproduce reproducing the exact network failure rates/environment is not really possible, but here are the simple steps sender: try to send a message while the 3 dots show that the client attempts to still send recipient: displays the same message (by the same sender) multiple times Actual result: Message is displayed multiple time (between 6 and 15 times in our cases) Expected result: The recipient detects that this is the identical message (via a message id, replay protection?) Device info Sender's Signal version: 3.25.3 and others Recipient's Signal version: 3.25.3 and others üëç 5

Steps to reproduce become a part of a group chat leave a group choose disappearing messages from menu change a setting Actual result: Group members are sending messages with new setting. Expected result: Disappearing messages settings can be changed only be existing members of a group chat. Device info Device: Multiple Android version: 4.3+ Signal version: 3.25.4

E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: AsyncTask #2 E AndroidRuntime: Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 25021 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occurred while executing doInBackground() E AndroidRuntime: at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:309) E AndroidRuntime: at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.finishCompletion(FutureTask.java:354) E AndroidRuntime: at
