java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:588) E AndroidRuntime: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818) E AndroidRuntime: Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.util.List android.content.pm.ParceledListSlice.getList()' on a null object reference E AndroidRuntime: at android.app.NotificationManager.getActiveNotifications(NotificationManager.java:683) E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.notifications.MessageNotifier.cancelActiveNotifications(MessageNotifier.java:133) E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.notifications.MessageNotifier.updateNotification(MessageNotifier.java:241) E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.notifications.MessageNotifier.updateNotification(MessageNotifier.java:172) E AndroidRuntime: at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.ConversationActivity$25.doInBackground(ConversationActivity.java:1356) E AndroidRuntime: at report.summary: Crash after sharing xlsx as jpg
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Signal crashes after sending a shared Excel-file (xlsx) which has been renamed to end with jpg. Afterwards it can't be used anymore. Steps to reproduce Rename a xyz.xlsx (Excel-File) to xyz.xlsx.jpg Share xyz.xlsx.jpg via signal to a contact Press the send button (The app crashes) Try to reopen the app Actual result: The app crashes in step 3 and can't be opened afterwards (step 4). The apps can only be restored to work with deleting all data via the android settings. Expected result: The best would be support xlsx files to be supported. The minimum requirement in my opinion is that the app rejects shared files that are not supported and doesn't keep crashing in this case. Screenshots n.a. Device info Device: Aquaris M5 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.26.2 Link to debug log A debug log can't be captured as signal crashes immediately after any restart attemp.

report.summary: Unencrypted MMS Messages Received and Displayed Twice After Delay
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I'm experiencing an issue with regular unencrypted MMS messages. Signal will receive and display the MMS message normally however after another 3 days it will display the same message a second time even though the sender only sent it along once. I switched my phone back to the stock SMS app (Google Messenger) for a while to see if I could reproduce the same behavior. Google Messenger displays MMS message a single time as expected. This behavior has been consistent for me since I installed Signal and it does not seem to matter what phone OS (Android or iOS) or messaging application (iMessage, etc.) the sender is using. Possibly related issues: #6003 #5525 Steps to reproduce Get a friend to send along a single MMS message Notice that the MMS message is received and displayed by your phone normally Wait 3 days Notice that the MMS message is received and displayed by Signal a second time Actual result: Single MMS messages are being received and displayed twice by Signal. Expected result: MMS messages are only received and display once in Signal. Screenshots https://goo.gl/photos/jFyRb3jeS8s9sshZ8 Notice the sent and received dates of both images. Device info Device: LGE Nexus 5X Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.27.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d166776852cf019e7c9552e2ee2ebfb2 Log was captured after MMS message was received and displayed the 2nd time.

report.summary: Crash when rotating screen with keyboard open

report.summary: Crash when opening group conversations if video calling is enabled
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Upon returning back to the app after a video call crashed Signal. Steps to reproduce make a video call end call do something else open Signal Actual result: crash Expected result: no crash I didn't super thoroughly test this but this happened after a video call on both devices. On one device I just let the screen turn off. Then when I opened it Signal crashed. On the other device I shared a link to Signal via Dropbox an when Signal opened it crashed. report.summary: Crash after closing video call

After hanging up, on the Acer device Signal crashes. Both run Signal 3.29.0. Actual result: Crash. Expected result: Normal closure, Screenshots Device info Device: Acer Z205 Android version: 4.4.2 Signal version: 3.29.0 Note: this device does not have a front camera, Signal shows automatically the image of the back camera. Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/1b659729fb19152b9deafe1ca43947d5 (There is a NPE at line 4472, maybe that's the problem?)

report.summary: One phone is silent in WebRTC call
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Repeatedly established a call with video calls enabled on both devices. Everything works fine, except that on the Android 4 device, one can't hear anything. Steps to reproduce Establish call between both devices (doesn't matter who) Actual result: Can't hear a thing on Android 4 device (video functionality works, and I can hear just fine on Android 6 device). (Edit: Regular, non-WebRTC Signal calls work just fine with the same devices.) Device info 1 Device: Samsung S III Mini Android version: 4.1.2 Signal version: 3.29.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/2c2abf3abb689ca0a4db2607a54fe84a Device info 2 Device: Motorola Moto G 2014 Android version: 6.0.1 (CM 13) Signal version: 3.29.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/2b7b458444a78db6d9f6028333e4088e üëç 2

report.summary: Screen goes to sleep during video call
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Video calls don't prevent the phone from turning off the screen. Steps to reproduce In an API 25 emulator: in the emulator's battery settings, set "Charger connection" to "none" and "Battery status" to "Discharging" in Android's Display settings, set a short display timeout (e.g. 15 seconds) start a video call Actual result: Screen goes dark after a few seconds Expected result: screen should stay on till the bitter end Device info Device: AVD Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.29.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/df33413cafdcebee09e67630e6f7fb9f

report.summary: Terminating video call from notification doesn't close call UI
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Steps to reproduce start a video call open Android notifications tap "End call" Actual result: video freezes, call still says "connected" until I cancel the call again in Signal's UI Expected result: call screen should close Alternative steps start a video call press home button open Android notifications tap "End call" open Signal from the app switcher / "Recents" view Device info Device: AVD Android version: 7.1.1 (also happened using a 4.2.2 physical device) Signal version: 3.29.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/2c798b21261953f2191d23c9374a6005

report.summary: Prevent webrtc and redphone from simultaneously connecting and sharing audio
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Accepting a redphone call while on a webrtc calls, connects both and enables audio for both calls simultaneously Steps to reproduce place and connect a webrtc call receive a redphone call accept redphone call Actual result: Audio is shared with both webrtc call and redphone call; video is still connected to webrtc call Expected result: Only call displayed on Android screen has audio/video permission; either place other call on hold or display "busy" to caller when receiver is already connected to other call Screenshots N/A Device info Device: Moto X Android version: 5.1 Signal version: 3.29.1 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/c86609a2156e55c814cb9a031b212bd9 üòÑ 2

report.summary: Signal crashes when typing a message/moving cursor in message
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When I am typing a message and moving the cursor around to fix a typo, every now and then the cursor is not responding as it should. You select a position in the message, try to delete a character (by hitting backspace). However not the character at which the cursor is pointing is removed, but the last one in the message. Continuing to correct most of the time results in a crash and restart of Signal. A work around is to exit the message and go back to the entry screen (message saved as draft) opening it again and continue the message. Not sure whether this is a quirk in the keyboard app or in Signal. I have not experienced this on my previous phone (Experia Z3 with Experia keyboard), so it might be keyboard related. Steps to reproduce Unfortunately I have not been able to come up with a sequence of steps to trigger this. A range of messages go OK and then for some reason this weird behaviour occurs. Actual result: Signal crashes Expected result: Signal should not crash on typing or correcting a message. Device info Device: Motorola Z Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.28.4 Keyboad used: GBoard - The Google Keyboard Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/ce4ebd92f92f5df67a55600d0ea68dde

report.summary: Notifications reappear arbitrarily after dismissal
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Notifications for unread messages reappear later when swiped away. No other app on my phone behaves this way and it is contrary to the purpose of a "notification": once dismissed it should not come back, I've been notified. Steps to reproduce Receive message Swipe away (dismiss) Android notification Wait (for indeterminate time, or another message to come in), notification reappears Actual result: Original notification reappears Expected result: Dismissed notification should not show up again Device info Android version: 7.0 Signal version: 3.28.4 üëç 1

report.summary: Messages shuffle on scroll
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Messages change to last messages seen at bottom or top of screen depending on direction while scrolling through message history. I have a secondary phone (Huawei P8lite) that does not appear to exhibit the same problem. First noticed this issue with Signal 3.28.4 Steps to reproduce Open a thread Quickly scroll up or down then flick down to end of conversation Actual result: Messages do not correspond to history Expected result: Messages should be as it were. Screenshots Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy J5 2016 (SM-J510GN) Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.29.6 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/tsdmgz/4f06f5369288a2e3cc8153748efde8db üòÑ 2

report.summary: [Beta call system] Speakers disabled when call is answered
report.label: bug
report.description: Bug description If you enable speakers before the call begins, when the other person get the call, your speakers will be disabled without any warning or message. Other apps (and the old calling system) keeps it enabled if you enable it prior to any call answered. Can anyone else reproduce this? Steps to reproduce enable beta calls on both sides make a call and quickly enable the speakers Actual result: When the other person accepts the call, your speakers will be disabled and you need to enable them again. Expected result: Speakers should be enabled. Device info Device: Sansumg S6 Android version: 6.x

report.summary: [Beta voice call] Call quality drops if signal is not open in foreground
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Call quality drops if you press the home button, open another app, or send Signal to the background in some other way Steps to reproduce Initiate Signal call Press home button Actual result: Audio starts cutting off Expected result: Shouldn't affect call quality Device info Device: Google Pixel Sailfish Android version: 7.1.1 NOF26V Signal version: 3.29.6 Link to debug log I have captured the debug log, but the recipient's entire number is visible in plain text after the line CALL_CONNECTED. I'll be happy to send it over a private channel. Also, that seems like a bug in itself

report.summary: Unread/last seen separator looks clunky and is hardly readable using dark theme
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The new unread separator looks very clunky (uses much screen space and thus notably reduces the message view "capacity", which is likely to suck on small displays) and has not been adapted to the dark theme. (Since issues with the dark theme most often go along with new features being introduced, the PR contribution template could perhaps be enhanced to include a test with both themes?) Steps to reproduce use dark theme receive a new message open the corresponding conversation Actual result: Unread/last seen separator looks clunky and is hardly readable using dark theme Expected result: Separator is readable und less "heavy" (in terms of size, especially the height) Screenshots Device info Device: Lenovo Moto G4 Plus Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.0 Link to debug log (omitted, since unnecessary)

report.summary: "New messages" divider ignores read state from the desktop app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The "new messages" divider ignores the read state from the desktop app. Steps to reproduce have a conversation on Signal Android continue the conversation on Signal Desktop return to Signal Android, where (correctly) no notification for a new message is shown Actual result: The "new messages" divider is shown between the last message on Signal Android and first message on Signal Desktop Expected result: The "new messages" divider shouldn't be shown Device info Device: LG Nexus 5X Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.30.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/c5f4419be37424c67a3e5883e4645c9a üëç 1

The call used video but only for a brief moment. Afterwards we used audio only. Steps to reproduce This crasher crash happened the second time for me but I cannot trigger it on purpose. report.summary: Send again doesn't show spinning element after pressing
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description If a message fails to send, the red exclamation mark takes one to the details view where the send again button is located. In earlier Signal versions the button disappeared after pressing it and some spinning element or dancing dots appeared, signalling that something is happening. Since a few versions now nothing happens visually after pressing even though Signal is trying to resend the message. This is confusing and leads to pressing the button again and again because nothing seems to be happening. Steps to reproduce Send a message that fails to send for whatever reason click for details press resend button Actual result: Nothing signals the user that something is happening, button stays active all the time Expected result: Deactivate the button and signal that something is happening Device info Device: Huawei Nexus 6p Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.29.6 üëç 2

report.summary: "Number not registered" when using "calling beta" in 3.30.4 - missing calls instead of ringing, too
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Using "video calling beta" from an Alcatel TCL 5010D to make a call to a Blackberry Classic with no-google-play-services, on the Alcatel appears this error: "Number not registered - The number you dialed does not support secure voice!". Both devices are running Signal beta 3.30.4. Alcatel has explicitly enabled "video calling beta" feature. Blackberry has it implicitly enabled, as per moxie0's comment in #6272 ("You don't see that settings, it's on by default for you"). [btw, before beta Signal 3.30.3, the Blackberry showed "Login failed!" when trying to place a call; now, from 3.30.3, no more "Login failed!"]. If, instead, I call from the Blackberry the Alcatel, on the Blackberry it seems all ok, ringing tone, but the Alcatel doesnt ring, and shows a missed call just after the Blackberry stops the ringing tone, manually or because of the timeout. Texts and attachments work ok on both directions (A->B, B->A). Alcatel device can place and receive audio calls correctly to/from other Signal accounts. Blackberry device has the same behaviour as detailed here with other Signal accounts. Steps to reproduce call the Blackberry from the Alcatel, and viceversa Device A info Device: Alcatel Pixi4 5010D Android version: 6.0 Signal version: beta 3.30.4 Device B info Device: Blackberry Classic Android version: 4.3 Signal version: beta 3.30.4 Link to debug logs Alcatel calling Blackberry mostly there is, it seems to me, not so much interesting data in the debug log: http://gist.github.com/ea2bc9fb1a190aa5c6a6a4eebfd2feb7 sometimes, something appears [e.g. handleNoSuchUser, I suppose]: http://gist.github.com/f6500cf47918bfa440fb9f665c3ac650 Blackberry calling Alcatel [last 2 account's digits edited to 00 for privacy] http://gist.github.com/6276fdd23691660ad81f3ea340a4f5fa

report.summary: Outbound (and maybe inbound?) calls are marked as unread
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Made an outbound call, once the call ended, the conversations screen showed the unread message divider with the call record beneath. Steps to reproduce make call Actual result: outbound calls are marked as unread by divider. Expected result: successful calls should not be marked as unread. Missed calls, on the other hand, should. Device info Device: Moto G4 Plus Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 beta

report.summary: Messages from Signal-Android appears twice on Signal-Desktop on latest beta
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description For a week or two almost every message I send from Signal-Android appears twice on Signal-Desktop. This includes pictures. Now before you tell me to go to Signal-Desktop instead, Lilia Kai said this might be a Signal-Android issue. WhisperSystems/Signal-Desktop#1038 (comment) Steps to reproduce Send a message with Signal-Android, it doesn't matter if Signal-Desktop is online or offline. At first it only consistently happened when Signal-Desktop was offline, but now it happens every message regardless of what I do. The message will appear twice on Signal-Desktop. Actual result: Messages appear twice in a row Expected result: Every message should only appear once Screenshots https://nup.pw/FARUE2.png Device info Device : motorola Moto G (4) (athene) Android : 6.0.1 (64, MPJ24.139-63) Memory : 52M (13.54% free, 384M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : ilclbld87 App : Signal 3.30.4 Signal-Android debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/4f0973a66b7fb88ecf575e8e178bc40d Signal-Desktop debug log https://gist.github.com/833edff1008c4197cf41e9bfb9f0a5bf üëç 1

report.summary: "In-conversation notifications" setting doesn't really work as intended
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description My mom has a Moto G3 and she often leaves the screen on when she's in a conversation with me while she's watching TV or whatever. The problem is that while the phone always beeps when she gets a new message, the beep is often really quiet/short when the screen is on and she's already in a conversation with me. "In-conversation notifications" is enabled, which is why it beeps at all. However, it seems the message is marked as "read" too quickly, so the beep is interrupted. My mom is old and she just can't hear the beep which means she can't respond right away when I'm texting her at the supermarket or whatever. Steps to reproduce Receive a message when your screen is on with the chat open, make sure "In-conversation notifications" is enabled in the settings Most of the time the notification beep is really short, which makes it easy to miss Actual result: The beep is seemingly interrupted Expected result: The beep is fully played, just like you'd expect it to Device info Moto G3 Latest non-beta Signal Android 6.0.1 Link to debug log Don't think this is necessary, but if it is just tell me and I'll post one

report.summary: Crash (password request) OR call activity fails to stop OR call screen does not close after hanging up a call immediately
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, If I make a call (both devices WebRTC enabled) and hang up immediately (before the recipient's phone rings) I often (but not always) get to Signal's login screen and have to enter the password again. I am not sure what happens. Perhaps Signal crashes and re-starts. Found with build 3.31.0 for Android.

When tried with called party phone unlocked, rings through speaker without any issue. #Steps to reproduce Lock phone "A" and call from phone "B" OR Lock phone "B" and call from phone "A" Actual result Locked phone rings through earpiece. Expected result: Locked device should ring through speaker. Device info Device "A" Nexus 5 Android version: 7.1.1 AOSP (No Gapps) Signal version: 3.31.0 Device "B" YU Yureka Android version: cm 13.0 (No Gapps) Signal version: 3.31.0 üëç 3 ‚ù§Ô∏è 1

report.summary: "Enable Signal for SMS" screen does not update after Signal becomes default SMS app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Clicking "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" works, but after Signal is made default SMS app the screen still displays this button. Steps to reproduce Signal is not default SMS app (only used for Signal contacts) Open Signal Use the pencil button to start sending a new message Click keyboard button to manually enter a number Enter a number that is not using Signal You can see the screen where the chosen number is displayed at the top but there is no message editing field at the bottom. The "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" button is displayed instead Click "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" Android asks if you want to change SMS app, click Yes Signal becomes your default SMS app Actual result: The screen stays the same: "ENABLE SIGNAL FOR SMS" button is still displayed at the bottom but it does nothing To actually send the message you have to click back and select the number again Expected result: Displayed screen should "find out" that Signal for SMS has been enabled and allow you to send the message immediately Screenshots Send message to a non-Signal number You need to enable Signal for SMS Confirm with Android, Signal becomes default SMS app after clicking Yes The screen should show the state below, but instead it shows the same screen as the second screenshot. To get the screen below you have to go back and choose the number again. Device info Device: Android Nexus 5x Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.30.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/c066f04a68813761a465d999063a06fa üëç 1

report.summary: In-conversation invitation broken if not default SMS app
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description The in-conversation invite feature does not work when Signal is not the default SMS app. That feature uses the usual text input field, which is in this case fully replaced by the enable SMS button. Steps to reproduce User A and user B are talking on Signal User A does not have Signal as default SMS app User B unregisters User A opens conversation with B, sees invite reminder Actual result: Tapping the invite reminder or choosing invite from the menu does not do anything. In the conversation list you can see that an invitation draft has been saved for that conversation. üëç 1

report.summary: Hanging up immediatly after call init behaves odd
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description I ended a new call by pressing the hangup button instantly after the starts (sonar sound just started playing the first time) Then the call was ended (no more sonar sound) but the WebRtcCallActivity was not closed. I just sat there waiting for nothing(?) After letting it ring some seconds (2 sonar pings) The hangup works as expected. And afterwards the this bug is not reproducible. But leads to this crash: #6348 (comment) Not sure yet, if this is the same issue... (will merge into 6348 if so) Steps to reproduce start Web RTC call press hangup immediatly after the button ist visible maybe helpful for repro: the recipient's Signal was not receiving any incoming call, cause it got and stayed killed after Debugging (Android Emulator) Actual result: Sometimes WebRtcCallActivity stays active, nothing more happens Expected result: WebRtcCallActivity gets closed Device info Device : Sony E5823 (E5823) Android : 6.0.1 (2701308494, 32.2.A.0.253) Memory : 36M (16.24% free, 512M max) Memclass: 192 OS Host : BuildHost App : Signal 3.31.2 Link to debug log After cleaning out the leaks, here you go: https://gist.github.com/McLoo/0074df6170a3b8d6856d5c69c89b7122#file-gistfile1-txt-L360 (I left WebRtcCallActivity and the Convo by back-button. Then locked Signal, to access the "Submit Debug log" faster) https://gist.github.com/McLoo/e5c6c93596a632b5dece6942fcbf1179#file-gistfile1-txt-L337 (left WebRtcCallActivity and the Convo by back-button, then Settings->Submit)

report.summary: Phone doesn't ring on incoming call in locked state

report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description As someone else noted in https://whispersystems.discoursehosting.net/t/videocalling-withios-not-possible/876/6 my device sometimes doesn't ring when it is locked. If it is unlocked it allways works. Note that this is a redphone call, as described here: WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS#1858 Steps to reproduce lock the phone get a call Actual result: Phone doesn't ring Expected result: Phone should ring Device info Device: Nexus 5X Android version: 7.1.1 Signal version: 3.31.4 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/dcab3736182311698178202cd0d61cea I let it ring for about 15 seconds before unlocking the phone üëç 1

report.summary: Downloading video keeps spinning forever on Moto G3
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Sometimes when I send a video to my mother's Moto G3, the video either Just sits there spinning Starts loading and then halfway through it goes back to spinning again I have no idea why this happens, the phone has plenty of free memory and the delete timer is set to 1 day so the chat isn't bloated at all. This has been happening for several months now and it's getting really annoying. Steps to reproduce Receive a video (It doesn't happen every time) Wait for it to finish loading... Oh wait! It never does! Restart the device It now works just fine Actual result: Videos get stuck downloading until a restart Expected result: Videos should never get stuck Device info Device : motorola MotoG3 (osprey_reteu) Android : 6.0.1 (2, MPIS24.107-55-2-5) Memory : 31M (14.53% free, 256M max) Memclass: 96, low-mem device OS Host : ilclbld36 App : Signal 3.30.4 In the most recent debug log below: App : Signal 4.1.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/494993a950189778dc6e6d7f469d1e58 https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0c21e2e84df4dcc8a7a3ecb3af8a34b7

I set it to small in version 4.4 and everything worked as expected. After the update to 4.5.0 the font size was back to normal and changing the preference has no effect. Steps to reproduce start Signal enter a conversation (font size is normal) change font size to small enter conversation (no changes) Actual result: the font size doesn't change Expected result: switch font size from normal to small Device info Device: Samsung Galaxy S5 Mini Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.5.0 (beta) Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/8156e4397c146a4ef362786e34e51c0a üëç 1

report.summary: Screen turns off during video playback
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description During video playback the screen turns off. There should be a wakelock preventing that the screen turns off when a video is playing. Steps to reproduce set turn off timer in Android settings to a short time (e.g. 15s) go to a conversation with a video attachment, that plays longer than the turn off time of the display tap this video wait as long as your display turn off time is (don't interact with the screen) Actual result: Screen turns off and interrupts video playback. Expected result: Screen stays on during video playback. Device info 1 Device: Fairphone 2 Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.6.0 Device info 2 Device: Sony Xperia U Android version: 4.4.4 (CyanogenMod) Signal version: 4.6.0 üëç 1

report.summary: Screen turns on, despite still being next to the ear (voice and audio messages)
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description When listening to an audio or voice message ends, the screen turns on and the touchscreen accepts input, despite the phone still being next to the ear, after listening to an audio or voice message. This leads to unwanted calling and other actions, the user never intended to do. Steps to reproduce Start listening to an audio or voice message. Hold the phone next to the ear, so that the screen turns off and input from the touchscreen is ignored. Wait for the audio or voice message to end. Actual result: The screen turns back on and input from the touchscreen is no longer ignored. Expected result: The screen stays off and input is ignored, as long as the phone is next to the ear. Device info Device: Moto X Play Android version: 6.0.1 Signal version: 4.6.0 Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/anonymous/d495bc418ede007bf7b5f563f446ea85 üëç 4

report.summary: Some sent group messages appear twice very briefly before first delivery mark
report.label: bug
report.description: I have: searched open and closed issues for duplicates read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports Bug description Sometimes, but not always, when I send a group message via Android, said message appears twice in a row for a split second. It will do so as long as the three delivery dots are jumping next to the lock icon, and the duplicate message disappears as soon as the first delivery mark appears. Below there is a video; unfortunately the interesting part is a bit hidden under the video editor's watermark. Screenshots Device info Device: Motorola Moto G 2014 Android version: 7.1.2 (Lineage) Signal version: 4.6.0 Link to debug log Here it is. Not the message from the screenshot! (The latter can be found here; it was sent around 15:09.)
